PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Q--Medical Services OFFADD: Southeast Regional Office, BOP, Bldg. 2000, 3800 Camp Creek Parkway, SW, Atlanta, GA 30331-5099 SUBJECT: Q--OPTOMETRIST SERVICES SOL RFQ 31101-0005 DUE 091900 POC Duane Donovan, Contract Specialist, 678-686-1405 DESC: The Federal Prison Camp, Maxwell Air Force Base, Montgomery, AL is soliciting written quotations for Optometrist Services. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Q--Medical Services OFFADD: Southeast Contracting Center MEDCOM, Dwight David Eisenhower AMC, ATTN MCAA SE, 39706 40th Street, Fort Gordon, GA 30905-5650 SUBJECT: Q--OBSTETRIC LABOR/DELIVERY NEWBORN NURSERY SERVICES SOL DADA08-00-R-0089 DUE 092500 POC Mettie Thomas, 706-787-3883 DESC: 17. Obstetric services, for Dwight David Eisenhower Army Medical Center (DDEAMC), Fort Gordon, GA and Graduate Medical Education Services for DDEAMC interns and residents, to be performed at Contractor's facility, as designated by DDEAMC. Contractor shall provide full inpatient obstetric labor, delivery and newborn nursery services for an estimated 690 delivereis annually (through out- years), including technical and clinical oversight, training and evaluation of DDEAMC's interns and residents. Services shall be available twenty-four (24) hours a day, seven (7) days a week. Performance shall be effective December 1, 2000 through September 30, 2001 (Base year). Purusant to the provisions of FAR 52.217-0009 and 52.217-0008, three (3) annual option periods with an additional option to extend services (NTE 6 months), will be available under the proposed contract. Request for proposal will be issued on or about September 8, 2000, with proposals due on September 29, 2000. This acquisition is being solicited on an unrestricted basis. Request for proposal copies must be submitted in writing to Southeast Regional Contracting Office, ATTN: MCAA SE, 39706 40th Street, Fort Gordon, GA 30905-5650. Fax request to (706) 787-6573. All responsible sources may submit an offer and all responsive offers will be considered. Telegraphic proposals are not authorized. EMAILADD: mettie.thomas@se.amedd.army.mil EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-244 SN492208)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Q--Medical Services OFFADD: Fleet&Industrial Supply Center, Regional Contracts Dept, Attn: Bid Officer/Code 210A94, 937 N. Harbor Drive, Suite 212, San Diego, CA 92132-0212 SUBJECT: Q--RENTAL OF A BACTEC 9120 BLOOD CULTURING SYSTEM AND THE BLOOD CULTURING MEDIA BOTTLES SOL N00244-00-T-1337 DUE 091500 POC Contracting Officer @619-532-2588; FAX 619-532-2347 DESC: IMPORTANT NOTICE: DFARS 252.204-7004 "Required Central Contractor Registration" applies to all solicitations issued on / or after 06-01-98. Lack of registration in the CCR database will make an offeror / quoter INELIGIBLE FOR AWARD. Please ensure compliance with this regulation when submitting your quote. Call 1-888-227-2423 or visit the Internet at http://www.ccr2000.com/ for more information. FISC San Diego is announcing its intent to issue a directed sole source procurement to Becton Dickinson&Company under authority of FAR 6.302-1. This procurement is unrestricted; all responsible sources may submit an offer. This is a combined synopsis / solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with FAR 13 and the format in FAR subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the ONLY solicitation; quotes are being requested and A SEPARATE WRITTEN SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED. Solicitation number / RFQ N00244-00-T-1337 applies; an electronic copy of the RFQ can be accessed at http://www.neco.navy.mil. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-16 and Defense Acquisition Circular 91-13. The standard industrial code is 2835,and the business size standard is 500 employees. The agency need is for the rental of a BACTEC 9120 blood culturing system and the culture bottles for these tests; (1) blood culture media plus aerobic. There are 50 bottles per case and the hospital requires 2 cases per month. (2) blood culture media plus anaerobic. There are 50 bottles per case and the hospital requires 2 cases per month. (3) the last item is blood culture media plus peds. There are also 50 bottles per case with this item and the hospital needs 3 cases per month. These items are for the Naval Hospital at Camp Pendleton. This contract is for a fixed price contract with a base year (10/1/00 thru 9/30/01) and three option years for the time thereafter. The quotes will be reviewed on the basis of the pricing of the base year and the option years. The provision at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items applies. Addendum to FAR 52.212-1, Paragraph (b)(5): Offers shall provide an express warranty which at a minimum shall be the same warranty terms, including offers of extended warranties, offered to the general public. Express warranties shall be included in the contract. Clause 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items applies. The following clause is also included 52.232-18, Availability of Funds. The clause at 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders - Commercial Items applies with the following applicable clauses for paragraph (b): FAR 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; FAR 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era, FAR 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; FAR 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era. DFARS 252.212-7001, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders Applicable to Defense Acquisitions of Commercial Items, applies with the following clauses applicable for paragraph (b): DFARS 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance of Payment Program; and DFARS 252.225-7012, Preference for Certain Domestic Commodities. OFFERORS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND INCLUDE A COPY OF THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS WITH THEIR PROPOSALS: FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representation and Certifications - Commercial Items. The government intends to make a single award to the responsible offeror whose offer is the most advantageous to the government considering price and price-related factors. Provision 52.212-2, Evaluation - Commercial Items, applies with paragraph (a) completed as follows: Award will be made to the offeror that meets the solicitation's minimum criteria for technical acceptability at the lowest price. The following clauses are also included FAR 52.217-5 and 52.217-9. In addition NAVSUP 5252.215-9402, Notice to Prospective Offerors, and 5252.215-9403, Additional Evaluation Factors - Contractor Evaluation System, Red / Yellow / Green Program applies. Note: The full text of the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) can be accessed on the Internet at www.arnet.gov.far or www.deskbook.osd.mil; Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) can be accessed on the Internet at www.dtic.mil/dfars. Parties responding to this solicitation may submit their quote in accordance with their standard commercial practices (e.g. on company letterhead, formal quote form, etc.) but must include the following information: 1) Company's complete mailing and remittance addresses, discounts for prompt payment, if any (e.g. 1% 10 days), anticipated delivery / availability of product / s, the company's CAGE code, Dun&Bradstreet Number, and Taxpayer ID number. In addition, if you are quoting on a comparable commercial item, product literature must be included. All FAR certifications and representations specified above must also accompany your quote. Quotes must be received no later than 3:00 PM, local time on 09-15-00, and will be accepted via fax (619-532-2347) or via e-mail (jessica_e_dunker@sd.fisc.navy.mil). Quotes submitted as an attachment to an e-mail should be sent in Word Version 6.0 or higher. LINKURL: http://www.sd.fisc.navy.mil LINKDESC: SD requirements. CITE: (W-244 SN492274)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Q--Medical Services OFFADD: U.S. Penitentiary, Leavenworth, Contracting Office, Leavenworth, Kansas 66048-1254 SUBJECT: Q--PHARMACY TECHNICIAN SOL 40804-3B1012 DUE 092800 POC Victor J. Stamps, Contract Specialist, 913-682-8700, ext. 303 Fax 913-682-1176 DESC: The United States Penitentiary, Leavenworth, KS., is soliciting a contract for the services of Pharmacy Technician (individual, firm or institution). The contract will consist of five (5) sessions per week for approximately six (6) hours in length. The awarded contractor will be required to perform assessments, to include, but limited to, reading prescriptions written by medical staff, determination of medications prescribed, transcribing prescription data to labels, preparing prescriptions to be reviewed prior to dispensing, and giving patient instructions when appropriate to federally incarcerated inmates. Only one (1) contract, which will include a base period and two option years, will be awarded as a result of this solicitation. The Request for Quotes solicitation package may be requested by submitting a written request via fax or mail. Telephone requests will not be honored. This requirement is 100% set aside for small businesses. All responsible sources may submit a quote for consideration. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: The Library Of Congress, Contracts And Logistics Service, FEDLINK Section, 101 Independence Avenue, SE Washington, DC 20540-9410 SUBJECT: R--FEDLINK INFORMATION RETRIEVAL SERVICES DELIVERY ORDERS FOR LRP PUBLICATIONS (PS) SOL 01-PS-1 POC Deborah Burroughs, Contract Specialist DESC: The Library of Congress intends to issue delivery orders against an existing Basic Ordering Agreement to renew subscriptions with LRP Publications (PS) for the continued use and access of their database system by the following FEDLINK member: SSLV. LRP Publications, Inc provides cyberFEDS on the Web. A subscription to cyberFEDS allows a quick and easy search of the summaries and full text of decisions by the EEOC, FLRA, MSPB, Comptroller General, OGE and related courts. Subscribers are able to search statutes, regulations, agency-specific documents, pay tables, classifications and qualification standards, newsletters, and more. In addition, federal employment experts contribute news, commentary and analyses on a daily basis. Service will be continued through September 30, 2001. NO SOLICITATION DOCUMENT EXISTS. No telephone calls will be accepted. WRITTEN RESPONSES SHOULD INCLUDE PRICES AND TECHNICAL DATA SUFFICIENT TO DETERMINE CAPABILITY. No award will be based on any offer or proposal received in response to this notice. (See Note 22). REF: 01-PS-1. CITE: (W-243 SN491975)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 30, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: The Library Of Congress, Contracts And Logistics Service, FEDLINK Section, 101 Independence Avenue, SE Washington, DC 20540-9410 SUBJECT: R--FEDLINK INFORMATION RETRIEVAL SERVICES DELIVERY ORDERS FOR CANADA INSTITUTE FOR SCIENTFIC AND TECHNICAL INFO.(CISTI) SOL 01-RC-1 POC Charles Wilson, Contract Specialist DESC: The Library of Congress intends to issue delivery orders against an existing Basic Ordering Agreement to renew subscriptions with Canada Institute for Scientific and Technical Information (CISTI) for the continued use and access of their database system by the following FEDLINK member: DCIL. This subscription is for access to a source of scientific, technical, medical, and agricultural information, through CISTI'S online document delivery services. CISTI offers several ways to order documents from a collection of over 54,000 journal titles, conference proceedings, monographs, technical reports, and translations. CISTI's Link Supply and Global Supply provide documents in any subject area from anywhere in the world. CISTI also retrieves items from the British Library Document Supply Centre (BLDSC) via its Global Supply service. CISTI's electronic table of contents service, CISTISource Select tables, is a current awareness service that offers unlimited searching on a subscription basis of some 14,000 journals published worldwide. Clients can receive these tables of contents automatically via the CISTISource Select Service to stay abreast of the newest publications in their area of scientific or technical interest. Service will be continued through September 30, 2001. NO SOLICITATION DOCUMENT EXISTS. No telephone calls will be accepted. WRITTEN RESPONSES SHOULD INCLUDE PRICES AND TECHNICAL DATA SUFFICIENT TO DETERMINE CAPABILITY. No award will be based on any offer or proposal received in response to this notice. (See Note 22). REF: 01-RC-1.
CITE: (W-243 SN491982)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 30, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: U. S. Department Of Commerce, NOAA, Central Administrative Support Center, 601 East 12th St., CC31, Rm. 1756, Kansas City, Missouri 64106 SUBJECT: R--EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM SERVICES SOL 52WCNA106002JAS POC Jackie Shewmaker,Contract Specialist, (816) 426-7129, extension 221 DESC: The U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), NOAA, intends to contract for Employee Assistance services to approximately 10,500 employees within DOC field offices serviced by four Administrative Support Centers (ASCs). These centers are the Eastern Administrative Support Center in Norfolk, VA; the Central Administrative Support Center in Kansas City, MO; the Mountain Administrative Support Center in Boulder, CO; and the Western Administrative Support Center in Seattle, WA. In addition, the Office of Finance and Administration (OFA) provides an employee assistance program to approximately 3,500 employees it directly services within the Washington, D.C. area. The following services will be required under the contract: 1. Clinical counseling and other life management assistance to DOC employees, their immediate family members, and anyone living within an employee's household who has an impact on the employee's well being; 2. Employee outreach and education programs; 3. Counseling and training for managers and supervisors; 4. A program for implementing the DOC Drug Free Workplace plan; and 5. Periodic reports which document the extent to which the required services were performed. These services are required in the United States, Alaska, American Samoa, Solomon Islands, Guam, and Hawaii. A fixed-price, requirements type contract for a 12 month base period and four twelve-month option periods is anticipated. All responsible sources may submit a request for the solicitation to the address listed herein. Facsimile requests will be accepted at (816) 426-7530. Only written or faxed requests will be accepted. The Solicitation will be issued on or about October 2, 2000. The Standard Industrial Classification Code is 8322. This is not set-aside for small business. CITE: (W-243 SN491990)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 30, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: The Library Of Congress, Contracts And Logistics Service, FEDLINK Section, 101 Independence Avenue, SE Washington, DC 20540-9410 SUBJECT: R--FEDLINK INFORMATION RETRIEVAL SERVICES DELIVERY ORDERS FOR ISI DOCUMENT SOLUTION (UI) SOL 01-UI-1 POC Charles Wilson, Contract Specialist DESC: The Library of Congress intends to issue delivery orders against an existing Basic Ordering Agreement to renew subscriptions with ISI Document Solution for the continued use of their services by the following FEDLINK member: HNTV. ISI Document Solution is a complete document delivery service, providing "one-stop shopping" for full-text retrieval. ISI Document Solution builds on over 40 years of service, providing a consistent, comprehensive, high quality document delivery service. As a full-service provider, ISI Document Solution (IDS) can deliver virtually any publicly available document- including but not limited to, journal articles, patents, conference proceedings, book chapters, government reports and more. Convenient ordering options include the Web, e-mail, fax, telephone, mail or through online vendors such as DIALOG, STN, OCLC, DIMIDI and DATASTAR. All orders are processed within 24 hours or upon special request and payment of a rush surcharge, can be delivered within as few as 30 minutes. Delivery is by fax, courier or traditional mail service. Service will be continued through September 30, 2001. NO SOLICITATION DOCUMENT EXISTS. No telephone calls will be accepted. WRITTEN RESPONSES SHOULD INCLUDE PRICES AND TECHNICAL DATA SUFFICIENT TO DETERMINE CAPABILITY. No award will be based on any offer or proposal received in response to this notice. (See Note 22). REF: 01-UI-1.
CITE: (W-243 SN491993)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 30, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: The Library Of Congress, Contracts And Logistics Service, FEDLINK Section, 101 Independence Avenue, SE Washington, DC 20540-9410 SUBJECT: R--FEDLINK INFORMATION RETRIEVAL SERVICES DELIVERY ORDERS FOR AOBC INTERLIBRARY LOAN SERVICE (IN) SOL 01-IN-1 POC Vanessa Fox, Contract Specialist DESC: The Library of Congress intends to issue delivery orders against an existing Basic Ordering Agreement to renew subscriptions with The American Overseas Book Company (AOBC) for the continued use of their services by the following FEDLINK member: DCIL. AOBC provides Interlibrary Loan (ILL) fee payment services to FEDLINK members. The FEDLINK ILL fee payment service provides an efficient method for federal libraries to pay ILL fees that may be charged by lending institutions to cover the cost of photocopying or other interlibrary loan processing costs. Service will be continued through September 30, 2001. NO SOLICITATION DOCUMENT EXISTS. No telephone calls will be accepted. WRITTEN RESPONSES SHOULD INCLUDE PRICES AND TECHNICAL DATA SUFFICIENT TO DETERMINE CAPABILITY. No award will be based on any offer or proposal received in response to this notice. (See Note 22). REF: 01-IN-1. CITE: (W-243 SN491999)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS (MODIFICATION) SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: General Services Administration, Federal Supply Service (FSS), Management Services Center (10FT), 400 15th Street, SW,, Auburn, WA, 98001 SUBJECT: R--ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES MULTIPLE AWARD SCHEDULE SOL TFTP-00-EL-00899-B POC Katherine Jocoy, Supervisory Contract Specialist, Phone (253) 931-7080, Fax (253) 931-7573, Email kathy.jocoy@gsa.gov - Edward Johnson, Contracting Officer, Phone (253) 931-7102, Fax (253) 931-7174, Email DESC: THIS SOLICITATION WAS POSTED AUGUST 30, 2000, UNDER NUMBER TFTP-EW-990899-2. Subject solicitation is a refreshed version of the standing Multiple Award Schedule solicitation for Environmental Services. This solicitation will be issued on or about 18 August, 2000. MAS solicitations do not have a closing date fro receipt of offers. The services covered in the scope include Environmental Planning Services and Documentation, Environmental Compliance Services, Environmental and Occupational Training Services, Waste Management, Hazardous Material Management, Remote Advisory Services, and Geographic Information Systems. The schedule explicitly excludes the transportation, cleanup, and disposal of hazardous materials or waste. The schedule provides for a base period of performance of five (5) years, with three (3) five-year option periods. GSA is only issuing this solicitation through the Electronic Posting System (EPS). The Internet address is http://www.eps.gov. All responsible sources may submit an offer which will be considered by the agency. Offers received based upon the previous solicitation (TFTP-98-SW-8999B) will not be accepted after 30 September 2000. LINKURL: http://www2.eps.gov/cgi-bin/WebObjects/EPS?ACode=M&ProjID=TFTP-00-EL-00899-B&LocID=8 LINKDESC: notice EMAILADD: kathy.jocoy@gsa.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (D-243 SN492020)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: 55 Broadway; Cambridge, MA 02142 SUBJECT: R--LIBRARY SERVICES SOL DTRS57-00-R-NA POC Point of Contact - Kathleen Foley, Contract Specialist, (617) 494-2824 DESC: The Volpe National Transportation Systems Center has a requirement for access to a library which can provide a wide range of material on transportation issues covering scientific and technical areas, social science areas, and policy and regulation areas. The contractor will be required to provide direct access to Volpe National Transportation Systems Center personnel by interlibrary loans with Volpe Center library, photocopy requests and reference services. Anticipated period of performance is a 21 month base period with one twelve month option. The Volpe Center intends to award a sole source procurement to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA. A market survey was conducted in June 2000 and the results of this survey support our determination to solicit and negotiate with only one firm. See Numbered Note 22. Interested parties must submit a written qualification package no later than 15 days after this publication. The Volpe Center maintains a home page on the Internet at URL: http//www.volpe.dot.gov/procure.htm where synopses and competitive RFPs, IFBs, and RFQs may be viewed or downloaded. This Notice is for informational purposes for Minority, Women-owned and Disadvantaged Business Enterprises (DBE): The Department of Transportation (DOT), Short-Term Lending Program (STLP) offers working capital financing in the form of lines of credit to finance accounts receivable for transportation related contracts. Maximum line of credit is $500,000 with interest at the prime rate. For further information, call (800) 532-1169. Internet address: http://osdb uweb.dot.gov. For information concerning the acquisition, contact the contracting official above. The services to be provided when ordered are: 1)Qualified real estate personnel to work on-site at the Denver Federal Center, Denver, Colorado and 2) a menu of Real Estate Services performed at the Contractor's facility on an "as needed" basis. These services involve support for the entire RMR consisting of the states of Colorado, Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota, Utah and Wyoming. The entire solicitation will be available only on this internet site. It is the Contractor's responsbility to monitor the site for the release of the solicitation and amendments, if any. The Proposal Due Date will be o/a 9/25/2000. Award is expected o/a 10/15/00. The contract performance period is one base year, plus four option years. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: The Library Of Congress, Contracts And Logistics Service, FEDLINK Section, 101 Independence Avenue, SE Washington, DC 20540-9410 SUBJECT: R--FEDLINK INFORMATION RETRIEVAL SERVICES SOL VAAE-UM POC Deborah L. Burroughs, Contract Specialist DESC: The Library of Congress intends to issue a delivery order against an existing Basic Ordering Agreement to renew a subscription with Bell&Howell Information and Learning Company for the continued use of their services by the Aleda E. Lute VA Medical Center, Saginan, MI (VAAE) Bell&Howell Information and Learning, a.k.a. University Microfilm Inc., offers Proquest Direct (online and CD products), document delivery and microform services under one agreement with FEDLINK. Bell&Howell Information and Learning offers reproductions of a large selection of periodicals, newspapers, journals, and other serial literature in microform available in the world. Student Reference Products are microform packages of full text primary source material, taken primarily from "The New York Times." Bell&Howell Information and Learning Research Collections offer collected works of historical value, as well as topics of contemporary concern in microform format. Also offers Phonefiche, a collection of telephone directories on microfiche. Bell&Howell Information and Learning's 1.2 million doctoral dissertations and Master's theses are preserved on microfilm and are available, on demand, in 35mm positive microfilm and 98-page-per-sheet positive microfiche for titles published after 1975. Service will be continued through September 30, 2000. WRITTEN RESPONSES SHOULD INCLUDE PRICES AND TECHNICAL DATA SUFFICIENT TO DETERMINE CAPABILITY. No telephone calls will be accepted. No award will be based on any offer or proposal received in response to this notice. NO SOLICITATION DOCUMENT EXISTS. (See Note 22). REF: VAAE/UM. CITE: (W-244 SN492312)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: Naval Surface Warfare Center, Code 1163, 300 Highway 361, Crane, IN 47522-5001 SUBJECT: R--ENGINEERING AND TECNICAL SERVICES SOL N00164-00-Q-0333 DUE 083100 POC Ms. Diane L. Pearson, Code 1163W7, telephone 812-854-5201; Ms. LuananShelton, Contracting Officer DESC: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for noncommercial services prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 13, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation number N00164-00-Q-0333 applies and is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). The proposed contract is 100% set-aside for small business concerns. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-19 and DCN 20000817. The standard industrial code is 8711 and the business size standard is $2.5 million (annual revenues). This requirement is as follows: CLIN 0001 Engineering and Technical Services in accordance with Statement of Work, Contract Data Requirements List, Data Item Description and DD254 which are available for downloading in MSWord 97 or to view in .pdf format. This is a sole source requirement to Indiana Pro Tech, RR1, Box 200, Williams, IN. Indiana Pro designed the ULM-4 URMITT Tracker and performed Electromagnetic Interference analysis of several SLQ-32 key components. Delivery is required F.O.B. Destination. The period of performance is 1 November 00 through 30 October 01. Final inspection will be at NSWC CRANE. All responsible sources may submit a quote that will be considered by the Agency. A Firm-Fixed Price purchase order will be awarded using Simplified Acquisition Procedures. The following provisions and clauses apply; 52.204-6; 52.207-4 [FILL-IN]; 52.209-6; 52.211-14 (DO); 52.211-15; 52.213-4; 52.219-1 [FILL-IN]; 52.219-6; 52.222-25 [FILL-IN]; 52.211-5; 52.211-17; 52.213-4; 52.219-6; 52.222-21; 52.222-22; 52.232-23; 52.237-1; 52.232-2; 52.242-17; 52.243-1; 52.246-1; 52.246-16; 52.249-1; 52.249-8; 52.253-1; 252.204-7001; 252.204-7003; 252.204-7004; 252.225-7000; 252.225-7001; 252.225-7002; 252.225-7009; 252.225-7017; 252.225-7035; 252.225-7036; 252.225-7037; 252.227-7013; 252.243-7001. Please provide your Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) code and Contractor Establishment Code (DUNS number). To be eligible for award you must be properly registered in the Government's Central Contractor Registration (CCR). Offerors may obtain information on CCR registration and annual confirmation requirements by calling 1-888-227-2423, or via the Internet @ http://ccr.dlsc.dla.mil or http://www.ccr2000.com. If a change occurs in this requirement, only those offerors that respond to this announcement within the required time frame will be provided any changes/amendments and considered for future discussions and/or award. Quotations may be faxed or e-mailed to Diane L. Pearson, FAX 812-854-3805, e-mail address pearson_d@crane.navy.mil. All required information must be received on or before 16 October 00 at 1200 Eastern Standard Time. See Note 26. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: National Cancer Institute, Research Contracts Branch, ESS, Executive Plaza South, Rm. 620, 6120 Executive Blvd., MSC 7224, Bethesda, MD 20892-7224 SUBJECT: R--TRADEMARK LEGAL ADVICE SOL N02-CO-11007 DUE 101600 POC James D. Carder, Contract Specialist, 301-435-3776 DESC: ELECTRONIC RFP ANNOUNCEMENT-POTENTIAL OFFERORS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR DOWNLOADING THEIR OWN COPY OF THE SOLICITATION AND ANY AMENDMENTS. The National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Cancer Institute (NCI), Office of Management, Technology Development&Commercialization Branch (TDCB), seeks a Contractor to perform Trademark Legal Advice services. The TDCB manages the trademark activities for the Public Health Service (PHS) The contractor shall perform varied trademark services ranging from searching for existing marks with senior rights, preparing and/or filing U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (PTO) trademark applications, preparing formal responses to PTO Office Actions, and preparing auxiliary documentation required by the PTO. The contractor shall provide assistance to the TDCB in its formal interactions with any foreign country's trademark office. The contractor shall review and edit draft documents and provide recommendations or comments on a proposed strategy or answer questions regarding points of law. The contractor shall provide full, detailed written opinions of counsel on important or complex aspects of law. The contractor shall negotiate licenses for use of marks. When changes in trademark law or procedures occur that will effect TDCB, the contractor shall provide training to the TDCB. The Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code is 8111. IT IS THE OFFERORS RESPONSIBILITY TO MONITOR THE ABOVE INTERNET SITE FOR THE RELEASE OF THE SOLICITATION AND ANY AMENDMENTS. The solicitation is expected to be issued on or about September 15, 2000. Proposals will be due approximately on October 16, 2000. No collect calls will be accepted. LINKURL: http://amb.nci.nih.gov/ncisc/rfps_published.asp LINKDESC: EMAILADD: carderj@mail.nih.gov EMAILDESC: e-mail CITE: (W-244 SN492345)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: Department of Commerce, Patent and Trademark Office (PTO), Office of Procurement, Box 6, Washington, DC, 20231 SUBJECT: R--ANALYTICAL SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF THE OFFICE OF HUMAN RESOURCES SOL 187P0000158 DUE 090500 POC Joan Hanicak, Contracting Officer, Phone (703) 305-8069, Fax (703) 305-8294, Email joan.hanicak@uspto.gov - Christopher Mikula, Contract Specialist, Phone (703) 305-8417, Fax (703) 305-8294, Email DESC: This is a sole source, combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, and the test program outlined in FAR 13.6, as well as supplemental information provided herein. This non-competitive action will be processed in accordance with FAR 6.301-1 (Only one responsible source and no other supplies or services will satisfy agency requirements). The PTO plans to utilize simplified acquisition procedures by awarding a sole source purchase order to Mr. Robert J. Egan of Huntingtown, MD. This follow-on purchase order is intended as a bridge procurement for the continuation of critical retirement planning services to the Office of Human Resources at the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office. These services include analysis and interpretations of the Civil Service Retirement System (CSRS) and the Federal Employee Retirement System (FERS) Programs. Also, these services include the assessment and recommendations regarding benefit information, counseling, and estimates to PTO employees considering retirement. The period of performance for this purchase order will be 10/01/2000 through 09/30/2001. This action will allow the PTO to continue receiving exceptional critical services without a lapse in effort. Near the end of this performance period, the PTO will compete this effort. This announcement constitutes the RFP and is the only solicitation that will be issued. This solicitation incorporates all of the applicable provisions and clauses in effect through FAC 97-19, as if stated in full text, as well as the terms and conditions of FAR 52.212-1. A firm fixed priced purchase order (or modification to previous purchase order) will be issued. A proposal shall be delivered to the Patent and Trademark Office, Office of Procurement, 2011 Crystal Drive, CPK 1, Suite 810, Arlington, VA 22202, Attention: Mr. Chris Mikula, no later than 2:00 PM (EST) on September 5, 2000. The point of contact for information regarding this solicitation is Joan Hanicak at (703) 305-8069 or Chris Mikula at (703) 305-8417. See Note 22. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: R--Professional, Administrative and Management Support Services OFFADD: Fleet&Industrial Supply Center, Regional Contracts Dept, Attn: Bid Officer/Code 210A94, 937 N. Harbor Drive, Suite 212, San Diego, CA 92132-0212 SUBJECT: R--NAVL RESERVE&RECRUITMENT ADVERTISING SOL N00244-00-T-1390 DUE 091500 POC Joan Balazs FAX 619-532-2347 Phone 619-532-2892 DESC: This is a combined synopsis-/-solicitation for a commercial item prepared in accordance with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. A copy of the RFQ (Request for Quotation) can be downloaded from the NECO web site at (http://www.neco.navy.mil). The solicitation number for this Request for Quotation is N00244-00-T-1390. This solicitation and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-19. This solicitation is issued on an unrestricted basis. FISC San Diego has a requirement for the following: CLIN 0001 Contractor to provide 113 Movie Screen Slides that will run on 18 theaters 4 states for 13 weeks for the purpose of advertising Naval Reserve&Recruiting. Screens are based on an equally spaced 3-slide program appearing at a 4.5 minute frequency. Messages will be shown approximately 3-6 times before the start of every show on each screen. The average moviegoer will receive 3.11 impressions of the slide advertisement. Spots are estimated based on 5 average shows per day taken from a survey of participating major circuits. Total impressions are determined by multiplying the total number of screens by the average weekly attendance per screen of 1366 moviegoers times the total number of weeks times the frequency of 3.11 impressions per moviegoer. Total # of markets 8, Total # of screens 113, Total # of Theatres 18, Total # of weeks 13, Total impressions 6,019,784, Total # of spots 154,245. Locations: California - Chico/Redding, Fresno, Los Angeles, San Diego, San Francisco, Hawaii Honolulu, Arizona Phoenix, Utah - Salt Lake City. Justification for other than full and open competition is FAR 6.302-1, Only one source or only a limited number of responsible sources. This proposed contract action is for supplies for which the Government does not have specifications and drawings to permit full and open competition. The Government intends to negotiate with National Cinema Network only unless other manufactures can be found. The following provision apply FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors Commercial Items, Addendum to FAR 52.000-1, Paragraph (b) (5) Offers shall provide an express warranty which at a minimum shall be the same warranty terms, including offers of extended warranties, offered to the general public. Express warranties shall be included in the contract. Offerors are required complete and include a copy of the following provisions with their proposals: FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representation and certifications Commercial Items. Clause FAR 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions Commercial Items, applies as well as the following addendum clauses; FAR 52.209-6 Protecting the Government's Interest When Subcontracting with contractors Debarred, Suspended or proposed for Debarment. FAR 52.211-17 Delivery of Excess Quantities. FAR.214-34 Submission of Offers In The English Language. FAR 52.214-35 Submission of Offers In U.S. Currency. FAR 52.222-3 Convict Labor. FAR 52.222-21 Prohibition of Segregated Facilities. FAR 52.225-13 Restriction on Certain Foreign Purchases. FAR 52.226-1 Utilization of Indian Organizations and Indian Owned Economic Enterprises. FAR52.232-33 Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer Central Contractor Registration. FAR 52.233-3 Protest After Award. FAR 52.242-15 Stop work Order. FAR 52.247-34 FOB Destination. FAR 52.211-5, New Material,. The clause at 52.212-5 Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statues or Executive Orders Commercial Item applies with the following applicable clauses for paragraph (b): FAR 52.222-26 Equal Opportunity; FAR 52.222-35 Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam Era Veterans, FAR 52.222-36 Affirmative Action for Handicapped Workers, FAR 52.222-37 Employment Reports on Special Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era,DFAR 252.207-7003 Control of Government Personnel Work Product. DFAR 252.225-7002 Qualifying Country Sources as Subcontractors. DFAR 252-225-7016 Restriction on Acquisition of Ball and Roller Bearings. DFAR 252.225-7036 Buy American North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act Balance of Payments Program. DFAR 252.225-7037 Duty Free Entry Eligible End Products. DFAR Pricing Of Contract Modifications. DFAR 252.246-7000 Material Inspection and Receiving Report. DFAR 252.225-7000 Buy American Act Balance of Payments Program Certificate. DFAR 252.204-7004 Required Central Contractor Registration, applies to all solicitations issued on or after 6/1/98. Lack of registration in the CCR database will make an offeror/quoter ineligible for award. Please ensure compliance with this regulation when submitting your quote. Call 1-888-227-2423 or on the Internet at http://ccr.edi.disa.mil for more information. DFAR 252.212-7001 Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders Applicable to Defense Acquisition of Commercial Items, applies with the following clauses applicable for paragraph (b), DFAR 252.225-7000 Buy American Act Balance of Payments Program Certificate, DFAR 252.225-7001 Buy American Act and Balance of Payment Program, and DFAR 252.225-7012 Preference for Certain Domestic Commodities. DFAR 252.212-7000 Offeror Representations and Certifications- Commercial Items. DFAR 252.225-7000 Buy American Act Balance of Payments Program Certificate. DFAR 252.225-7006 Buy American Act-Trade Agreements-Balance of Payments Certificate. DFAR 252.225-7020 Trade Agreements Certificate. DFAR 252.225-7035 Buy American Act- North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act Balance of Payments Program Certificate. The Government intends to make a single award to the responsible Offeror whose offer is the most advantageous to the Government considering price and price related factors. Provision 52.212-2 Evaluation Commercial Items applies with paragraph (a) completed as follows: Award will be made to the Offeror that meets the solicitation's minimum criteria for technical acceptability at the lowest price. To be determined technically acceptable the Offeror must furnish product literature that demonstrates the products offered meet all requirements stated in the above purchase descriptions for Line Items 0001-0005. All responsible Offerors are to submit current pricing, delivery time, payment terms, cage code, Dunn and Bradstreet number, Tax Identification Number and all applicable specifications regarding this solicitation. Also required are copies of applicable commercially published price lists pertaining to your company's products that meet the specifications. Quotes must be received no later that 3:00 p.m. PST, September 15, 2000, and will be accepted via FAX (619-532-2347) Attn: Joan Balazs Clause information can be downloaded from the internet from the following addresses; http://www.arnet.gov/far/ or http://www.acq.osd.mil/dp/dars/dfars/dfars.html

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: S--Utilities and Housekeeping Services OFFADD: Contracting Officer (90C), Department of Veterans Affairs, North Texas Health Care System, 4500 South Lancaster Road, Dallas, TX 75216 SUBJECT: S--SOLID WASTE COMPACTOR MONITORING SERVICES SOL 549-RFQ-101-00 DUE 091800 POC Belinda L Cook (214) 857-0037 DESC: This solicitation shall be issued as a Request for Quotations and in accordance with the provisions of FAR Sub Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items. FAR clauses 52.212-1, 212-3, 212-4 and 212-5apply through (FAC 97-19). The VA North Texas Health Care System, Dallas Medical facility, anticipates award of a contract for the provision of solid waste compactor monitoring and associated notification of solid waste compactor monitoring from an off site station. It shall be the responsibility of the contractor to provide and install all associated equipment and materials to provide the services. It is anticipated that the contract start on or about 10-1-2000 for a basic period with two options that allows the VA to unilaterally extend the contract by 12 months each. Interested parties may obtain a copy of the solicitation and/or amendments free at the following URL: http://www.va.gov.oa&mm/busopp/sols.htm. Requests for hard copies of the solicitation and/or amendments may be obtained for a cost of $10.00 and must be in writing to Belinda L. Cook, Contract Specialist, VANTHCS, and (90C), 4500 S. Lancaster Road, Dallas, Texas 75216. The request must be accompanied by a check made out to the Department of Veterans Affairs. Phone, fax or e-mail request will not be accepted. The anticipated issue date of the solicitation is on or about September 1, 2000 with the anticipated bid opening on or about September 18, 2000. CITE: (W-244 SN492454)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: T--Photographic, Mapping, Printing, and Publication Services OFFADD: Fleet&Industrial Supply Center, Regional Contracts Dept, Attn: Bid Officer/Code 210A94, 937 N. Harbor Drive, Suite 212, San Diego, CA 92132-0212 SUBJECT: T--PHOTOCOMPOSITION, DIGITIZED ARTWORK AND MAINTENANCE OF PMS DATABASE SOL TBD POC Brian O'Donnell, Contract Specialist (619) 532-3445; Mary O'Brien, Contracting Officer DESC: The Fleet and Industrial Supply Center, San Diego intends to issue a competitive solicitation to provide photocomposition, computer digitized artwork, and maintenance of the Navy's Planned Maintenance System (PMS) utilizing the contractor's software and hardware. Deliverables include, but are not limited to, generating camera ready copies, loading new documents into the database, generating indices, master file updates, listings and providing to the Government on-line access to the unclassified portion of the database. Delivery under the contract will be FOB Destination (San Diego CA and Norfolk VA). The period of performance will be for a period of a base year and 4 option periods. This is a follow-on procurement to N00244-95-D-5150 established with Volt Alphanumeric Publication Systems. The contractor must have a confidential facility security clearance, and be able to process classified information on the computer system. A performance demonstration/validation is necessary and contractor must demonstrate an acceptable level of production.

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: T--Photographic, Mapping, Printing, and Publication Services OFFADD: U.S. Securities&Exchange Commission, Procurement And Contracts Branch, Mail Stop O-20, 6432 General Green Way, Alexandria, Virginia 22312 SUBJECT: T--MAGAZINES AND NEWSPAPER SUBSCRIPTIONS. SOL SECHQ-00-Q-0031 POC Nadine Hughes, (202) 942-4998, or Gary Fontaine Contracting Officer, (202) 942-4990 DESC: The U. S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has a need to obtain a variety of newspaper and magazine subscriptions for multiple subscribers to be delivered Monday through Friday, and weekend editions for Saturdays/Sundays and Holidays, to the SEC's library in the Securities and Exchange Commission Headquarters building, Washington, D.C. Period of performance is from October 1, 2000 through September 30, 2001. This is a request for a 100% small business-set-aside. (1) The contractor shall deliver the following newspapers by 6:15 a.m. Monday- Friday (including editions for Saturdays/Sundays and holidays delivered on the next business workday) and during inclement weather, in the estimated quantities of : 33 each New York Times, Mon-Sat; 2 each New York Times, Sunday edition; 14 Washington Posts, Mon-Fri; 7 each Washington Posts, Sat. edition; 2 each Washington Posts, Sunday editions; 15 each Wall Street Journals, Mon-Fri; 3 each Washington Times, daily including Sunday; 4 each USA Today, Mon-Fri; 1 each International Herald Tribune, Mon-Sat; 1 each Los Angeles Times, Mon-Fri and Sunday; 1 each New York News, daily including Sunday; and 1 each New York Post, daily including Sunday. (2) The contractor shall deliver the following magazines by 6:15 a.m. every Monday (including editions for holidays delivered on the next business workday) and during inclement weather in the estimated quantities of: 3 each New Republic, 7 each Barrons, 2 each Money, 3 each Forbes, 3 each Fortune, 3 each Time, 4 each Newsweek, 3 each Business Week, and 4 each U.S. News and World Report. (3) The contractor shall deliver the following magazines by 6:15 a.m. every Friday (including editions for holidays delivered on the next business workday) and during inclement weather in the estimated quantities of: 7 each Economists.(4) Newspapers and magazines shall be bundled and labeled separately on each account. (5) The contractor must have the ability to quickly make changes in quantity. Delivery Terms: F.O. B. U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, 450 5th Street NW, Room 1C00, Washington, DC 20549. An award will be made to the most technically acceptable responsive offer using a best value analysis. Technical considerations and past performance are significantly important. Documentation shall establish a bona fide capability to meet the above requirements. Responsible parties having the ability to meet this requirement are to respond in writing within 15 days after publication of this notice to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, P&C Branch, Stop 0-20, 6432 General Green Way, Alexandria, VA 22312. CITE: (W-244 SN492223)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: T--Photographic, Mapping, Printing, and Publication Services OFFADD: U. S. Environmental Protection Agency, Contracts Management Division (MD-33), Attention: OARSC, Research Triangle Park, NC 27711 SUBJECT: T--SUPPORT FOR PHOTOCOPYING SERVICES SOL AC0112 DUE 091100 POC James F. Kempf, Contract Specialist, (919) 541-4278/Janice White, Contracting Officer, (919) 541-3166 DESC: THIS IS A COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION FOR COMMERCIAL ITEMS PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FORMAT IN SUBPART 12.6, AS SUPPLEMENTED WITH ADDITIONAL INFORMATION INCLUDED IN THIS NOTICE. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES THE ONLY SOLICITATION; QUOTES ARE BEING REQUESTED AND A WRITTEN SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED. The solicitation number is AC0112 and the solicitation is being issued as a Request for Proposal solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-18. The Environmental Protection Agency anticipates the award a firm-fixed-price purchase order for the period 10/1/2000 through 9/30/2001. This procurement is a TOTAL SMALL BUSINESS SET ASIDE and the SIC No. is 7334 with a size standard of $5M in average annual receipts over the preceding three fiscal years. This procurement is a follow-on to Purchase Order 8D-2143-YTSA with Qualex International. The Environmental Protection Agency contracts for operators to work in its photocopying center at the N.C. Mutual Life Insurance Building, 9th floor, 411 Chapel Hill Street, Durham, NC. The center is presently equipped with Kodak 3100 Copier, Standard Bindfast 5 Binder, Bostitch stitcher and stapler, 3-hole punch paper driller, Ibico Spiral Binder, and personal computer. This equipment may be replaced or supplemented during the course of this contract. The center produces 300,000 - 700,000 impressions per month. WORK REQUIREMENTS: The Contractor shall provide qualified operators to operate all duplicating and binding equipment in the EPA photocopy center at N.C. Mutual Life Insurance Building. A qualified operator is defined as one with previous experience in operating the respective equipment, or one who has had at least two (2) days training, physically operating the equipment, in accordance with the manufacturer's recommended operation procedures. The operators shall process original copy material for duplication and binding operations such as stapling, glueing, spiraling, and/or tape binding using simple binding equipment. All documents copied and bound by the Contractor shall be treated as confidential and handled in accordance with clause EPAAR 1552.235-71, Treatment of Confidential Business Information, incorporated herein by reference. The Contractor shall use and provide directions to EPA employees in the use of any equipment. Operation or all photocopy equipment shall be in accordance with the manufacturer's recommended procedures. The Contractor shall notify each requestor via telephone or electronic mail within 24 hours when copy material is completed. Work for off-site employees shall be boxed, labeled, and deposited in receptacles for outgoing mail within 24 hours of completion. An on-site EPA requestor will be notified to pack up his or her work after it has been completed. Only materials accompanied by an authorized work request shall be processed for duplication. Work orders shall be processed on a first-in, first-out basis unless a work order is designated by the Project Officer as priority. Then it shall be processed before the routine orders. A copy of each work order processed during each calendar month shall be retained and shall be furnished to the Project Officer upon request. The Contractor shall monitor the usage of all supplies required for the operation of the photocopy center, which will be stocked by the Government, and shall notify the Project Officer of supply needs one week in advance of order placement to insure timely reordering and delivery. The Project Officer will inform the Contractor of the ordering schedule after award. The Contractor shall immediately notify the Project Officer via telephone in the event of equipment breakdown. The Contractor shall maintain a record of all breakdowns including system downtime and submit it to the Project Officer each month. The Contractor shall operate the photocopy center in two shifts -- one shift from 8:00 a.m. until 4:30 p.m., 8 hours daily; the second shift from 4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m., excluding Saturday, Sunday and Government holidays*. One individual shall be provided for each shift. The half-hour overlap will insure continuity of work from one shift to the other. The operators shall sign in and sign out on daily operational logs to identify all hours of operation, a copy of which shall be submitted to the Project Officer each month. In the event an operator fails to report for duty or becomes incapacitated during normal work hours, an alternate qualified operator shall be provided by the Contractor within two (2) hours after the Contractor becomes aware of the situation. CALCULATION FOR NONPAYMENT - In accordance with the provisions of the FAR 52.232.1, Payments, deductions will be made from the fixed price of this contract for the hours not worked. No payment shall be made to the Contractor for periods in which the services are not being performed due to absence of any operator. Nonpayment will be calculated by multiplying the hours of non-operation, times the hourly rate (total hours amount of the contract per period divided by 3,132 hours of the contract). This amount will be deducted from the invoice of the month the hours were not worked. The Contractor shall submit the following documents to the Project Officer on the last working day of each month: 1) a daily log of work accomplished, 2) meter reading report, 3) record of all machine breakdowns and system downtime, and 4) copies of sign in/out sheet(s) and/or log of hours of operation as certified by contractor representations. The Contractor shall follow good housekeeping practices and shall keep the supply area neat and orderly. *Government Holidays are as follows: New Year's Day As observed by Government Martin Luther King's Birthday 3rd Monday of January Washington's Birthday 3rd Monday of February Memorial Day Last Monday in May Independence Day As observed by Government Labor Day 1st Monday of September Columbus Day 2nd Monday of October Veterans Day As observed by Government Thanksgiving Day 4th Thursday of November Christmas As observed by Government The Services Contract Act of 1965, as Amended, FAR clause 52.222-41 applies to this procurement. Wage Determination No. 1994-2401, Revision No 12 applies. The minimum wage rate for a Duplicating Machine Operator is $10.66/hours. Evaluation criteria to be included in paragraph (a) of provision 52.212.2 are as follows: Offerors will be evaluated on 1) their demonstrated ability to provide this type of service by providing supporting documentation that demonstrates their experience in management of printing services; 2) their demonstrated ability to provide monthly reporting capabilities. Requirements are monthly reporting for: reporting breakdowns of machinery and retaining records of downtime to Project Officer Monthly; a daily log of work accomplished; meter reading support; copies of sign/out sheet(s) with hours of operation as certified by contractor representations. Offerors should provide supporting documentation that demonstrates their ability to provide these reporting capabilities; and 3) Past Performance - offerors should provide information on prior similar work performed, giving a brief description, contacts, phone numbers, and contract purchase order numbers. Technical requirements and Past Performance are more important than price. The following FAR provisions apply (which can be downloaded at the following site: http://www.epa.gov/oamrtpnc/spclaus/index.htm)apply to this solicitation: 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors Commercial Items, and 52.212-2, Evaluation Commercial Items. Offeror shall include with their offer a completed copy of provision 52.212-3, Offror Representations and Certification-Commercial Items. The following FAR clause applies to this acquisition: 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items. The following additional FAR clauses which are cited in clauses 52.212-5 are applicable to the acquisition: 52.203-6, Restrictions on Subcontractor Sales to the Government, with Alternate I: 52.203-10, Price or Fee Adjustment for Illegal or Improper Activity; 52.217-9, Option to Extend the Term of the Contract; 52.219-14, Limitation on Subcontracting; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam Era Veterans; 52.222.36, Affirmative Action for Handicapped Workers; 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Special Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Viet Nam Era; EPAAR 1552.209-71 Organizational Conflicts of Interest; EPAAR 1552-210-78, Management Consulting Services, EPAAR 1552.235.71, Treatment of Confidential Business Information; Far 52.245-1, Property Records (The Government shall maintain the Government's property records in connection with Government Property under this contract. The Government Property clause is hereby modified by deleting the requirement for the Contractor to maintain such records); 52.245-2, Government Property; 52.246-4, Inspection of Services Fixed Price; and 52.249-8 Default. Offerors price proposal must provide a complete breakdown of their proposed amount. For example, if you are quoting an hourly rate, you must state so and provide supporting documentation for this rate i.e.; 3 invoices of similar services to other than EPA that show you have charged this rate to other customers. If your unit cost is made up of other items i.e. labor rate, overhead, G&A, profit materials, travel, conference facility, etc., you must provide a complete breakdown with appropriate supporting documentation (negotiated rate agreement for example) on the a pricing/cost information sheet (sample available upon request). Price and technical information should be submitted to James F. Kempf, Contract Specialist, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, MD-33, Research Triangle Park, NC 27711. Courier Delivery Address is: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Receptionist-Administration Bldg. Lobby, Attn: James F. Kempf, 79 T.W. Alexander Drive, Research Triangle Park, NC 27709. All offers are due by September 7, 2000, 4:00PM EDT. No telephonic requests will be honored.

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: U--Education and Training Services OFFADD: Fleet Industrial Supply Center Norfolk, Detachment Philadelphia, 700 Robbins Ave., Bldg. 2B, Philadelphia, PA 19111-5084 SUBJECT: U--ACADEMIC SUPPORT SERVICES SOL N00140-00-R-4046 DUE 101600 POC J. B. VanAllan, Contract Negotiator, 215-697-9655, Contracting Officer, M. Cesarone DESC: FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia intends to solicit for academic support services for the Navy's Voluntary Education program designated as Navy College Program (NCP). These services shall be provided for afloat and ashore based personnel at worldwide Pacific locations. The services shall encompass labor, management, and supervision in support of the NCP. Contractor support shall involve two categories of personnel. For Category One, contractor support shall include one or more of the following services: 1) Educational Advisement, Counseling, and Briefing, 2) Test Administration, 3) Tuition Assistance, 4) Computer Lab Facilitating, 5) Education Planning, 6) Program Management of on-base/distance education programs and 7) Administrative/Clerical Assistance. For Category Two, contractor support shall include only the services pertaining to Administrative/Clerical Assistance. Both Category One and Category Two Contractor support services shall advertise, assist, and encourage eligible personnel in their pursuit of personal and professional development by enhancing and encouraging access to academic skills and college level instruction. The goal of the Contractor support services is to assist military members and eligible civilians in the completion of college degrees. A Firm Fixed Price type contract utilizing Commercial Item procedures is anticipated. The contract shall consist of a base period beginning 01 Dec 2000 or time of award, whichever is later, through 30 Sep 2001, with four (4) twelve month options. The solicitation shall require the submission of technical proposals, and may include a requirement for a cost/price proposal as well. This acquisition is a 100% set-aside for firms certified in the Small Business Administration's Section 8(a) Program, who qualify under SIC code 7379 with a size standard of $18M. All responsible sources may submit a proposal which shall be considered by FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia. Requests for a copy of the Request for Proposal (RFP) should be made by letter or telefax (215) 697-9738) to FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia, Code 02P52I. The RFP will also be available electronically upon its release at www.nor.fisc.navy.mil and www.neco.navy.mil. LINKURL: www.nor.fisc.navy.mil LINKDESC: CITE: (W-244 SN492083)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 31, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: U--Education and Training Services OFFADD: Fleet Industrial Supply Center Norfolk, Detachment Philadelphia, 700 Robbins Ave., Bldg. 2B, Philadelphia, PA 19111-5084 SUBJECT: U--ACADEMIC SUPPORT SERVICES SOL N00140-00-R-4047 DUE 101600 POC J. B. VanAllan, Contract Negotiator, 215-697-9655, Contracting Officer, M. Cesarone DESC: FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia intends to solicit for academic support services for the Navy's Voluntary Education program designated as Navy College Program (NCP). These services shall be provided for afloat and ashore based personnel at US East Coast and overseas Atlantic region locations. The services shall encompass labor, management, and supervision in support of the NCP. Contractor support shall involve three categories of personnel. For Category One, contractor support shall include one or more of the following services: 1) Educational Advisement, Counseling, and Briefing, 2) Test Administration, 3) Tuition Assistance, 4) Computer Lab Facilitating, 5) Education Planning, 6) Program Management of on-base/distance education programs and 7) Administrative/Clerical Assistance. For Category Two, contractor support shall include only the services pertaining to Administrative/Clerical Assistance. For Category Three, Contractor support shall include operation of the Navy College Program Call Center (NCC). Both Category One and Category Two Contractor support services shall advertise, assist, and encourage eligible personnel in their pursuit of personal and professional development by enhancing and encouraging access to academic skills and college level instruction. Category Three contractor support shall encourage all contacted personnel to continue their education and shall assist all contacted personnel in obtaining pertinent educational information. The goal of the Contractor support services is to assist military members and eligible civilians in the completion of college degrees. A Firm Fixed Price type contract utilizing Commercial Item procedures is anticipated. The contract shall consist of a base period beginning 01 Dec 2000 or time of award, whichever is later, through 30 Sep 2001, with four (4) twelve month options. The solicitation shall require the submission of technical proposals, and may include a requirement for a cost/price proposal as well. This acquisition is a 100% set-aside for firms certified in the Small Business Administration's Section 8(a) Program, who qualify under SIC code 7379 with a size standard of $18M. All responsible sources may submit a proposal which shall be considered by FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia. Requests for a copy of the Request for Proposal (RFP) should be made by letter or telefax (215) 697-9738) to FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia, Code 02P52I. The RFP will also be available electronically upon its release at www.nor.fisc.navy.mil and www.neco.navy.mil. LINKURL: www.nor.fisc.navy.mil LINKDESC: CITE: (W-244 SN492085)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: U--Education and Training Services OFFADD: Fleet&Industrial Supply Center, Regional Contracts Dept, Attn: Bid Officer/Code 210A94, 937 N. Harbor Drive, Suite 212, San Diego, CA 92132-0212 SUBJECT: U--INSTRUCTOR TRAINING FOR DIETER'S CQD BASIC AND STT COURSES SOL N00244-00-T-1386 DUE 090600 POC Pamela Thom (619) 532-2573 or Teddy Santos (Contracting Officer) (619) 532-2555 DESC: The Fleet and Industrial Supply Center San Diego intends to issue a sole-source, firm-fixed-price purchase order using simplified acquisition procedures to procure Instructor Training for Naval Special Warfare Center (NSWC) personnel for CQD 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Phase Basic Underwater and Demolition SEAL (BUD/S)and CQD SEAL Tactical Training (STT) Courses. The BUD/S and STT courses are intended to prepare the SEAL operator, squad and platoon to control and dominate the close quarter fight. The courses will be mission and battle focused; and include mechanisms to ensure that instruction remains standard, consistent and up-to-date over time. The scope of this contract includes delivery of the comprehensive CQD Instructor Training; CQD Instructor Guides; CQD Lesson Plans and CQD Tac-House Guides for the CQD courses listed above. This is a continuation of the effort started under Contract N00244-97-C-5208, dated 29 September 1997. The Government anticipates a twelve month performance period. A DoD Secret Security Clearance is required. The SIC Code is 8299 (Schools and Educational Services), which has a small business size standard of $5 million. The FSC Code is U008 (Training/Curriculum Development). The total small business set-aside request for quotations will be issued on 31 August 2000 with a closing date of 06 September 2000 at 2:00 p.m. PDST. See Notes 1 and 22.
