PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 66--Instruments and Laboratory Equipment OFFADD: U. S. Environmental Protection Agency, Contracts Management Division (MD-33), Attention: OARSC, Research Triangle Park, NC 27711 SUBJECT: 66--PM2.5 CONTINUOUS PARTICLE SPECIALTION MONITOR SOL PM0059 DUE 091100 POC James F. Kempf, Contract Specialist, (919) 541-4278/Janice White, Contracting Officer, (919) 541-3166 DESC: THIS IS A COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION FOR COMMERCIAL ITEMS PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FORMAT IN SUBPART 12.6, AS SUPPLEMENTED WITH ADDITIONAL INFORMATION INCLUDED IN THIS NOTICE. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES THE ONLY SOLICITATION; QUOTES ARE BEING REQUESTED AND A WRITTEN SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED. The solicitation number is PM0059 and the solicitation is being issued as a Request for Proposal solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-18. The Environmental Protection Agency anticipates that the contract will be awarded to Andersen Instruments Incorporated as a result of this solicitation. A firm-fixed-price purchase order is anticipated to result from the award of this solicitation. This procurement is NOT a total small business set aside and the SIC No. is 3829 with a size standard of 500 Employees. This procurement is not a follow-on to a prior contract. This acquisition is for the delivery, FOB Destination, EPA Research Triangle Park, NC, 27709, of a PM2.5 Continuous Particle Speciation Monitor. The EPA, Office of air Quality Planning and Standards (OAQPS) is currently assisting states in implementing the National PM2.5 Chemical Speciation Network. State and local agencies are expected to have approximately 300 speciation samplers in the fully-implemented network. A major component of this program is the National PM2.5 Speciation Trends Network which consists of 54 sites located in major metropolitan areas which will initially collect samples on a one in three day basis. In FY2001, ten of these sites will be required to collect samples on a daily basis. Current sampling technology does not permit daily sample collection and OAQPS must assess the adequacy of new continuous particulate and gaseous monitors which could be used by state agencies to meet daily requirements. In addition, there is some concern that aerosols that are being collected by samplers using filtration techniques are altered by either sorption of gaseous pollutants or lose constituents because of aerosol volatilization during sampling. OAQPS is planning to address these concerns through the procurement of a monitoring system which is uniquely capable of measuring both water soluble gas phase and particulate pollutants. The monitor, developed by Andersen Instruments, will be briefly operated by OAQPS at Research Triangle Park and then be collocated with filter-based speciation samplers at one of the National Speciation Trends Sites and operated by a state agency for a 3-6 month assessment study. The detailed specifications for the monitor are as follows: Physical Specifications: 1. The central unit of the analyzer shall be modular in design, allowing for easy access for servicing. 2. The total weight of each analyzer shall no exceed 80 pounds. 3. The AC input power cord to the primary power supply shall be 3 conductor and at least 9 feet in length, with a standard 3-prong grounded plug. The supply voltage shall be nominal, 115 plus or minus 10 VAC. 4. The on-site data logger/controller shall include all software and control capabilities necessary to operate and calibrate the analyzer. 5. The analyzer unit and data logger/controller shall have a digital read-out on the front panel that continuously displays the previous hourly averaged concentration of each PM2.5 particulate species analyzed from ambient air (display shall include surrogate standard concentration). 6. The analyzer shall be provided with an on-board data logger/controller with the memory capacity for over six months of hourly averaged values. 7. the analyzer shall be equipped with a temperature sensor to automatically correct for temperature changes. 8. The sample flow rate of the system shall be controlled to 16.7 liters per minute (LPM), to maintain the proper cut-point through the inlet of the instrument. 9. The sampler shall be equipped with at least one RS232 port. The RS232 ports shall allow data collection via an on-site personal computer. 10. The inlet tube and hardware support kit shall include all necessary hardware required for normal operation )i.e. Tubing, inlet bracket, unions, etc.). 11. Equipment must by listed and labeled by athird party listing agency approved by the North Carolina Building Code Council. (List of agencies available upon request). Performance Specifications: These specifications describe the minimum acceptable quality or performance level of the equipment. Superior alternatives will be considered as compliant to specifications. 1. The instrument limit of detection shall be approximately +/- 0.05 micrograms/cubic meter or better. 2. The instrument shall have user-selectable full-scale ranges at from 0-5 microgram/m3 to 0 to 100 microgram/m3 for each compound analyzed. 3. The instrument shall have the capacity to inject liquid standards for calibration. 4. The accuracy of the instrument for each compound shall be +/- 10% or better at the midrange of the respective calibration span. 5. The instrument shall maintain a PM2.5 size cut at a sample flow rate of 16.7 LPM using the Sharp Cut Cyclone inlet. The instrument shall have control of the inlet flow to +/- 5% or better of the expected 16.7 LPM. 6. The analyzer shall operate within specifications at room temperature ranging from 15 degrees C to 35 degrees C. Any temperature change within this range shall no cause more than +/- 2% change of actual reading at any point on the scale. Analyzer shall not be damaged or require recalibration after exposure to ambient temperature variation between 4 degrees C to 44 degrees Ce while in operation. 7. Each instrument shall possess the ability to perform surrogate standard injections with each sample analysis. The surrogate standard shall be used as an indicator for calibration drift. 8. All tubing shall have connections, controls, and fittings that are designed for rapid, easy and repeated disassembly and re-assembly, as may be required for cleaning, and repair. The following FAR provisions apply(which can be downloaded at the following site: http://www.epa.gov/oamrtpnc/spclaus/index.htm)apply to this solicitation: 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items; Offerors shall include with their offer a completed copy of provision 52.212-3, Offror Representations and Certification-Commercial Items. The following FAR clause applies to this acquisition: 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items. The following additional FAR clauses which are cited in clauses 52.212-5 are applicable to the acquisition: 52.203-6, Restrictions on Subcontractor Sales to the Government, with Alternate I: 52.203-10, Price or Fee Adjustment for Illegal or Improper Activity; 52.219-14,Limitation on Subcontracting; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam Era Veterans; 52.222.36, Affirmative Action for Handicapped Workers; 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Special Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Viet Nam Era. Price and technical information should be submitted to James F. Kempf, Contract Specialist, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, MD-33, Research Triangle Park, NC 27711. Courier Delivery Address is: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Receptionist-Administration Bldg. Lobby, Attn: James F. Kempf, 79 T.W. Alexander Drive, Research Triangle Park, NC 27709. All offers are due by September 11, 2000, 4:00PM EDT. No telephonic requests will be honored.

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 66--Instruments and Laboratory Equipment OFFADD: U.S. Department of Agriculture, ARS, LPSI, East Side Service Center, Bldg. 307, Room 129, BARC-East, Beltsville, MD 20705 SUBJECT: 66--MICROLOG 3 IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM FOR IDENTIFYING UNKNOWN ANAEROBIC BACTERIA SOL 0011275107-00317 DUE 091800 POC John Wilkinson, Telephone (301) 504-5799, Fax (301) 504-8696 DESC: USDA intends to award a procurement request for a "Microlog 3 Identification System" with Catalog Number: 62401A (or an equivalent), which is manufactured by Biolog, Inc. in Hayward, California; which shall meet the following specifications: Automated system for characterizing and indentifying unknown anaerobic and aerobic bacteria, and yeasts, system based on carbon source untilization tests that are read automatically and recorded in seconds, The identified microbial species is displayed as a characteristic finger print, progressive identification pattern matching algorithm considers the organisms preffered carbon sources, strain relationships are displayed as a graphic output in the form of cluster diagrams-to find relationships among microbial communities and populations, the system is flexible so that pre-defined protocols can be used or specific needs can be developed. The above system uses a "Proprietary Carbon Source Utilization Test Methodology". Each Plate has ninety-five different indentified carbon sources. USDA also intends to purchase a YT Database(for Yeasts) from Biolog, Inc. with Catalog number 22405A (or Equivalent). A copy of the solicitation will be made by WRITTEN REQUEST ONLY. This solicitation incorporates clauses that are in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-18. This acquisition will be solicited on a UNRESTRICTED basis. The Standard Industrial Classification Code is 3829. Delivery is F.O.B. Destination to the U.S. Department of Agriculture in Beltsville, Maryland. Any interested/qualified sources who can provide the item stated above (or equivalent), must respond by September 18, 2000. All responses will be evaluated in order to determine the capabilites stated in the RFQ. The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsive/responsible offerer whose quote conforms to the solicitation and will be most advantageous to the Government based on price. This procurement will be conducted under Far Part 12, Commercial Items. CITE: (W-244 SN492094)

Tedesco ph (732)323-7789 fax (732)323-2359 tedescola@navair.navy.mil DESC: NAWC AD Lakehurst, NJ intends to enter into negotiations on a sole source basis with Thermo Optek Corporation, Franklin, MA, to procure one year of maintenance service for the following: Baird Onespark Optical Emission Spectrometer S/N 3842 and ARL X-Ray Flouresence (XRF) 9400 Spectrometer S/N 0228 part of the Materials Lab equipment. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 66--Instruments and Laboratory Equipment OFFADD: National Institute of Diabetes, Digestive&Kidney Diseases (NIDDK), Acquisition Management Branch, 6705 Rockledge Dr., MSC 7973, Room 8048, Bethesda, Maryland 20892-7973 SUBJECT: 66--SCIENTIFIC EQUIPMENT SOL NIH-NIDDK-00-588 DUE 092500 POC Patricia Haun, Purchasing Agent, 301-594-8855 DESC: The National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK) has a requirement to purchase Scientific Equipment, a NBS Model ML-6100 Touch-screen Controller (24"W x 8"D x 30"H) and accessories from New Brunswick Scientific Co., Inc., 44 Talmadge Road, Edison, NJ 08818. The following specifications must be in the NBS Model ML-6100 Controller: 1) Control Hardware; 2) Touch-screen Interface; 3) Wire Termination Strip; 4) Power Supply; 5) Cable Connections; 6) NEMA 4 Cabinet; 7) Temp. loop, RTD with connection cable; 8) pH loop, Transmitter with connection cable; 9) DO loop, Transmitter with connection cable; 10) A set of Operating Manuals and Installation and training. The Touch-screen Controller must be compatible with the existing 300 liter bioreactor (fermentor). The Institute intends to purchase this equipment by other than full and open competition from New Brunswick Scientific Company Inc. To the best of the Governments knowledge they are the sole manufacturer and distributor of this equipment. Interested vendors may identify in writing their interest with a capability statement to the Contracting Office prior to the closing date of this notice. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed acquisition is based upon responses to this notice and is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. It is anticipated that Request for Quotation (RFQ) NIH-NIDDK-00-588 will be available fifteen (15) days after the publication date of this synopsis. Receipt of quotations will be due ten days (10) after the release of the RFQ. The anticipated award date is September 27, 2000. Quotations must be submitted in writing to the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases 6705 Rockledge Drive, Building One, Room 8048, Bethesda, Maryland 20817-7973 Attention: Patricia Haun. FAX quotations must contain offerors names, address, telephone number and fax number. FAX quotations will only be accepted if dated and signed by an authorized company representative. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 66--Instruments and Laboratory Equipment OFFADD: Naval Surface Warfare Center, Code 1163, 300 Highway 361, Crane, IN 47522-5001 SUBJECT: 66--RADIO TEST SET W/ ACCESSORIES SOL N00164-00-Q-0334 DUE 091200 POC Ms. Kathy Noel, Code 1163W2, telephone 812-854-3692; Ms. LuananShelton, Contracting Officer DESC: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation Number N00164-00-Q-0334 is hereby issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). The proposed contract is NOT set-aside for small business concerns. Incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-19 and DCN 20000831. The Standard Industrial Classification Code for this procurement is 3812 and the size standard is 750 employees. This requirement is for the following: CLIN 0001 - 1 ea Radio Test Set (includes printer cable and manuals), IFR Americas, Inc. Item #S33160A2HP1, CLIN 0002 - 1 ea W4 Cable, IFR Americas, Inc. Item #AAJ201-4, CLIN 0003 - 1 ea TF-204A Bit Test Adapter, IFR Americas, Inc. Item #AAJ203, CLIN 0004 - 1 ea LK-204 Lockout Key for RPM-002, IFR Americas, Inc. Item #AAJ204, CLIN 0005 - 1 ea Rack Mount Kit, IFR Americas, Inc. Item #AAPS02, CLIN 0006 - 1 ea LK-122 Lockout Key for RPM-001, IFR Americas, Inc. Item #AAJ105. This requirement is sole sourced to IFR Americas, Inc., Wichita, Kansas. This equipment must integrate in terms of form, fit, function, and compatibility with the AN/ARC-164 UHF Communications Radio. Delivery is required F.o.B. Destination within 90 days after award. Final inspection will be at NSWC, Crane. Selection for award will be based on past performance and price. This will be a firm fixed price contract and will be awarded utilizing Simplified Acquisition Procedures. The contractor shall extend to the Government the full coverage of commercial sale warranty provided such warranty is available at no additional cost to the Government. Clauses/provisions: 52.211-14(DO); 52.211-15; 52.212-1; 52.212-3 Alt l [FILL-IN]; 52.212-4; 52-212-5; (incorporating 52.222-21; 52.222-26; 52.222-35; 52.222-36; 52.222-37; 52.232-33) 52-242-10; 52-247-29; 252.246-7000; 252.204-7003; 252.204-7004; 252.212-7001). The offeror shall provide its Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) Code, Contractor Establishment Code and Tax Identification Number. To be eligible for award you must be properly registered in the Government's Central Contractor Registration (CCR). Offerors may obtain information on CCR registration and annual confirmation requirements by calling 1-888-227-2423, or via the internet @ http://ccr.dlsc.dla.mil or http://www.ccr2000.com. If a change occurs in this requirement, only those offerors that respond to this announcement within the required time frame will be provided any changes/amendments and considered for future discussions and/or award. All responsible sources may submit an offer, which will be considered by the agency. Quotations may be faxed or e-mailed to Kathy Noel, FAX 812-854-3805, e-mail address noel_k@crane.navy.mil. All required information must be received on or before 12 Sep 2000, 3:00 PM Eastern Standard Time. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 66--Instruments and Laboratory Equipment OFFADD: National Institute of Diabetes, Digestive&Kidney Diseases (NIDDK), Acquisition Management Branch, 6705 Rockledge Dr., MSC 7973, Room 8048, Bethesda, Maryland 20892-7973 SUBJECT: 66--SCIENTIFIC EQUIPMENT SOL NIH-NIDDK-00585 DUE 092500 POC Patricia Haun, Purchasing Agent, 301-594-8855 DESC: The National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK) has a requirement to purchase Scientific Equipment, specifically one (1) 2-D Gel Electrophoresis System, 2-D Spot Cutter, PDQuest software and accessories from Bio-Rad Life Science Group, 2000 Alfred Nobel Drive, Hercules, CA 94547. The specifications shall be included in the following systems: 1) PROTEAN IEF System; 2) PROTEAN II xi Cell, 20cm, 1.5 mm spacers (4) 1.5-well comb (2); 3) PROTEIN II xi Cell IPG Conversion Kit, 1.0 mm, 18.5 x 20 cm; 4) Teflon Comb, 10 Well, 1.0mm; 5) Teflon Comb, 10 Well, 1.5mm; 6) SPACERS, 20CM X 1.0MM, 4; 7) PROTEOMEWORKS SPOT CUTTER; 8) Teflon Comb, 15 Well, 1.0mm; 9) SPACERS, 20CM X 1.0MM, 4; 10) ReadyStrip IPG Strips, 3-10pH, 17cm, 12/pkg.; 11) ReadyStrip IPG Strips, 3-6pH, 17cm, 12/pkg.; 12) ReadyStrip IPG Strips, 5-8pH, 17cm, 12/pkg.; 13) ReadyStrip IPG Strips, 7-10pH, 17cm, 12/pkg.; 14) 12%TRIS, PII Ready Gel, IPG; 15) Discovery Series PDQuest PC; 16) Warranty. The system allows 2-D analysis of proteins or peptides followed by visualization and archiving of the results and automated. Spot cutting from 2-D gel matrices. This is the only commercially available integrated system that starts with the electrophoresis procedures and ends with the ability to analyze material by mass spec or other methods. The Institute intends to purchase this equipment by other than full and open competition from Bio-Rad Life Science Group. To the best of the Governments knowledge they are the sole manufacturer and distributor of this equipment. Interested vendors may identify in writing their interest with a capability statement to the Contracting Office prior to the closing date of this notice. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals, however, all responses received before the closing date of this announcement will be considered by the Government. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed acquisition is based upon responses to this notice and is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. It is anticipated that Request for Quotation (RFQ) NIH-NIDDK-00-585 will be available fifteen (15) days after the publication date of this synopsis. Receipt of quotations will be due ten days (10) after the release of the RFQ. The anticipated award date is September 27, 2000. Request for copies of the RFQ must be in writing and may be FAXED to 301-480-4226. Quotations must be submitted in writing to the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases 6705 Rockledge Drive, Building One, Room 8048, Bethesda, Maryland 20817-7973 Attention: Patricia Haun. FAX quotations must contain offerors names, address, telephone number and fax number. FAX quotations will only be accepted if dated and signed by an authorized company representative. CITE: (W-244 SN492364)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 66--Instruments and Laboratory Equipment OFFADD: Department of Health and Human Services, National Institutes of Health, National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute, Contracts Operations Branch, 6701 Rockledge Dr RKL2/6100 MSC 7902, Bethesda, MD, 20892-7902 SUBJECT: 66--INSTRUMENTS AND LABORATORY EQUIPMENT SOL NHLBI-PS-2000-663 DUE 091900 POC Deborah Coulter, Purchasing Agent, Phone (301) 435-0366, Fax (301) 480-3345, Email dc143b@nih.gov DESC: The National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute intends to purchase a Fiber Optic Gating System and components manufactured by MedRad/MRE Inc. The items to be purchased are: 1. one (1) each of product #MRE 70200, Model 9500 Multigas Monitor, includes Pulse Oximetry, ECG and NIBP, 2. two (2) each of product #95298, Model 2500 Fiber Optic ECG Gating Module (the second cable will be a two (2) lead-off ECG patient module), 3. one (1) each of product #MRE 70270, End-tidal CO2 Module, 4. one each of product #MRE 70100, Remote Display and Control, 5. one (1) each of product #MRE 70085, Thermal Strip Printer, 6. one (1) each of product #MRE 95396, Model 2500 Intface ECG Gating Cable (GE), 7. one (1) each of product #INS 9500, Installation of model 9500 monitor, to include the following options: a. one (1) each of product #MRE 90206, 180 FT. Remote Control, and Display Substitute cables, b. one (1) each of product #MRE 71112, Swing Arm Wall Mount for 9500, c. one (1) each of product #MRE 71113, Model 9500 Remote Control Display Swing Arm Wall Mount. The Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code is 3826 and the Size Standard is 500 employees for this requirement. There are no small business set-aside restrictions for this requirement. This acquisition is being conducted under simplified acquisition procedures. Interested vendors capable of furnishing the government with the products in this synopsis should submit two (2) copies of a quotation to the below address. The quotation shall include the itemized price, prompt payment terms, the F.O.B. Point (Destination or Origin), Taxpayer Identification Number (TNN), Dun&Bradstreet Number (DUNs), and descriptive literature of the product quoted. The quotation must reference _Solicitation number_ NHLBI-PS-00-663. Quotations will be due fifteen (15) calendar days from the publication date of this synopsis or September 19, 2000 by 8:30 a.m. local time, whichever is later. All responsible sources may submit a quotation, which if timely received, shall be considered by the agency. Quotations must be submitted in writing to the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute, Contracts Operations Branch, Procurement Section, 6701 Rockledge Drive, Bethesda, MD 20892-7902, Attention: Deborah Coulter. Fax quotations will only be accepted if dated and signed by an authorized company representative. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS (MODIFICATION) SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 67--Photographic Equipment OFFADD: Department of the Air Force, Air Mobility Command, 375th Contracting Squadron, 201 East Winters Street, Building 50, Scott AFB, IL, 62225-5015 SUBJECT: 67--PROJECTION SYSTEM UPGRADE SOL Reference-Number-6730-Projection-System DUE 090800 POC Steven Sills, Contract Specialist, Phone 618-256-9263, Fax 618-256-5237, Email steven.sills@scott.af.mil - Cindy Showers, Contract Specialist, Phone 618-256-9250, Fax 618-256-5237, Email DESC: The purpose of this modification is to respond to questions made at the site-visit held for this solicitation, and to extend the response date. The questions and responses are informational for all potential bidders. 1. In regards to the wireless Touch Panel, does the customer desire (a) A handheld LCD, with black and white display or color display, or (b) A handheld pushbutton? Response: Handheld color display pushbutton remote. 2. Is the existing Creston touch panel to remain? It is assumed the new wireless touch panel will have the same functionality as the existing. Is this correct? Response: Yes, the existing Creston touch panel is to remain. Yes, the new wireless touch panel will have the same functionality as the existing. 3. We understand your intentions are to utilize the Smartboards as projection screens. Will they be directly connected to their respective projector, or is any switching capability desired? Response: Switching capability is desired, information from the Smartboards should be able to be saved to the computer hard drive. The response date is changed to 8 Sep 00. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 68--Chemicals and Chemical Products--Potential Sources Sought OFFADD: Fluor Fernald, P.O. Box 538704, Cincinnati, OH 45253-8704 SUBJECT: 68--CHEMICALS&CHEMICAL PRODUCTS--INDUSTRIAL HYGIENE CHEMICAL ANALYSIS SOL 0000000 DUE 092200 POC Ms. Theresa Payne (MS 52-9), P.O. Box 538704, Cincinnati, OH 45253-9704 DESC: Fluor Fernald, Inc., Prime Contractor for the United States Department of Energy's (DOE) Fernald Environmental Management Project (FEMP), Fernald, Hamilton/Butler County, Ohio, seeks interested laboratories to perform industrial hygiene chemical analysis for Fluor Fernald, Inc. under a requirements contract. These laboratory services are specific to the generation of industrial hygiene chemical (organic, inorganic) data of documented and known quality. The quality of data and the methodologies used in the generation of the data must meet the requirements set forth in the contract. The services to be provided require the processing of samples of various types of materials to determine the quantity of specific chemical constituents via primarily OSHA and NIOSH protocols. The materials to be analyzed are airborne contaminants. These filters may contain high levels of RCRA hazardous constituents and radioactive materials (Uranium and Thorium). Interested laboratories shall have at a minimum a NRC or Agreement State License to accept low-level radioactive samples for analyses. Expression of interest must be submitted in writing to Fluor Fernald, Inc. ATTN: Ms. Teresa Payne (MS 52-9), P.O. Box 538704, Cincinnati, OH 45253-9704 by September 22, 2000. This CBD notice does not commit the United States Government and/or Fluor Fernald, Inc. to pay for any costs incurred in the preparation and submission of data or for any other costs incurred prior to the execution of a subcontract. TELEPHONE INQUIRIES WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL.***** LINKURL: www.fernald.gov LINKDESC: EMAILADD: teresa.payne@fernald.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-244 SN492169)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 70--General-Purpose Information Technology Equipment OFFADD: DHHS, Program Support Center, Division of Acquisition Management, ADP Branch, Room 5-95 Parklawn Bldg., 5600 Fishers Lane, Rockville, MD 20857 SUBJECT: 70--INNOVATIVE MILLENNIUM PACKAGE SOL 00X201035 DUE 091100 POC Bettie L. Hartley, Contracting Officer, 301-443-7848 DESC: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; a quotation is being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This request for quotation (RFQ), number 00X201035 is for the purchase and delivery of "Innovative Millennium Package". The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Program Support Center knows of only one source, Innovative Interfaces, Inc., 5850 Shellmound Way, Emeryville, California 94608. The Contractor shall provide Millennium Software as follows:1) Millennium Management Reports; 2) Millennium Circulation; 3)Millennium Serial Processing; 4)Millennium Acquisitions; 5) Millennium Database Management; 6) Advances Searching; 7)WEB OPAC interface to Encyclopedia Britannica; 8) Export Bibliographies 9); Automatic authorities processing; 10) Alphabetical sort locations; 11) Location synchronization and 12) Choice of two software items. The Contractor shall also provide Millennium Services as follows: 1) re-indexing of authority records to accommodate automatic authorities processing; 2) re-indexing of ISN index; 3) Selective indexing of punctuation in phrases indexes; 4) re-indexing of 505 title subfields; 5) 125 Character phrase indexing; 6) non-normalized browse displays and 7) Conversation of hardwired connections to network connections, if required.. In addition, 192MB memory and Percon portable barcode memory. Solicitation documents, provisions and clauses herein are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-18. The provision at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors--Commercial Items (MAR 2000), and the clause at FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions--Commercial Items (May 1999), applies to this acquisition. Offerors shall submit a fully executed copy of the provision at FAR 52.212-3, Offerors Representations and Certifications--Commercial Items (FEB 2000) with their offer. The clause at FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Require to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders--Commercial Items (AUG 2000), applies to this acquisition as well as the following clauses cited therein: FAR 53.222-26, Equal Opportunity (E.O. 11246); FAR 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era (29 U.S.C. 793); FAR 52-222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities (29 U.S.C. 793); FAR 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Disabled Veterans of the Vietnam Era (38 U.S.C. 4212); FAR 52.225-3, Buy American Act - Supplies (41.U.S.C.) and FAR 52.232-34, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--Other than Central Contractors Registration (31 U.S.C. 3332). This notice is not a request for competitive proposals. Firms having the ability to provide the software, as stated above, shall provide clear and comprehensive information supporting its claim, inclusive of references listing contact person(s) and phone number(s); technical literature; GSA schedule, if applicable; and pricing. A determination by the Government not to compete with this proposed contact based upon responses to this notice is solely with in the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. Direct all questions or inquires, referencing RFQ number, by fax to (301)443-2761 or telephone (301)443-7848. Quotation shall reference the RFQ number and be sent to the attention of Bettie Hartley at the above address. Receipt of quote shall be with in 8 days from the date of publication. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 70--General-Purpose Information Technology Equipment OFFADD: Department of the Treasury, Bureau of the Public Debt (BPD), Division of Procurement, UNB 4th Floor, 200 Third Street, Parkersburg, WV, 26101-5312 SUBJECT: 70--SOFTWARE PACKAGE SOL Sole-Source-Ringwood POC Loretta Osuna-Cotto, Contract Specialist, Phone (304) 480-7127, Fax (304) 480-7203, Email procurement@bpd.treas.gov - Susie Daugherty, Contracting Officer, Phone (304) 480-7138, Fax (304) 480-7203, Email DESC: Subject to final approval, The Bureau of the Public Debt intends to acquire, on a sole-source basis through Ringwood Software Inc a software package that meets the following requirements. The software shall: 1. Allow a minimum of 400 user licenses and up to 3 system administrators. 2. Be user-friendly. 3. Be versatile and adaptable for development of procedures, user manuals, etc. 4. Provide the design of the e-Handbook which facilitate training by incorporating the university/course theme. 5. Be compatible with existing Call Center and Public Debt technology. 6. Be compatible with, and operable on PC workstations with the following minimum configurations: 1600 Mb HD, 133 MHz, Windows 95/98/2000, Word 2000, and 32 Mb RAM and servers with the following minimum configurations: NT 4.0 SP 6.1, ISS 4.0, SQL 7.0, 512 Mb RAM, and 6 Gb HD. 7. Provide print capabilities for producing hardcopies of created documents. 8. Allow flexibility so that Public Debt personnel can customize documents. 9. Administrators shall have change management and control capability of the e-Handbook. 10. Provide the capability to limit user access to system information. 11. Provide _access control levels_ (in addition to _read, write and delete_) so that specific documents can be limited to various individuals. 12. Provide _search_ capabilities such as key word indexing and flexible searching and cross-referencing. The software shall generate a return list of documents that matches the search criteria and provides ability to select from list and _return_ capability when navigating through the Index. 13. Automatically generate a table of contents. 14. Provide hot spots and flyovers to provide users with more detailed or related information on a topic. 15. Provide navigation tools or directories in view or on the same page 16. Provide a notes feature so that users are able to insert their personal annotations in documents 17. Provide bookmark capability. 18. Provide revision history which includes time, date, user and revision marks available to PSS, ability to revert to original document, call attention to revised text for user, and summary page of revisions. 19. Provide link-checking function which ensures all embedded links work and are accurate. 20. Provide capability to establish links to intranet/internet pages and documents outside e-Handbook document. 21. Provide a development region or directory for Administrators to make and test changes before copying to the production region/directory. 22. Provide _File locking_ to prevent unauthorized or conflicting changes to files. 23. Provide the capability to convert documents developed in Word 97/2000 with little or no modification to the original format. 24. Have the capability to import or link to Adobe PDF documents. 25. Allow customization of styles by developers to ensure design consistency. 26. Provide capability to track and produce site/access/use statistics 27. Provide technical support. 28. Contain flexible viewing (zoom and full page/form) capabilities. 29. Provide Page/print screen capabilities. 30. Provide single source document capability to allow for ease and simplicity of maintenance and version control. 31. Provide Windows compatibility so that material is presented in sizeable windows. No solicitation document is available. A request for documentation will not be considered an affirmative response. If no affirmative written response is received by close of business on September 14, 2000, to the effect that a comparable service is available, and that it is more advantageous to the Government than obtaining this package through sole-source contract, a sole-source award will be made. Telephonic inquiries will not be accepted. LINKURL: http://www2.eps.gov/cgi-bin/WebObjects/EPS?ACode=P&ProjID=Sole-Source-Ringwood&LocID=1743 LINKDESC: notice EMAILADD: procurement@bpd.treas.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (D-244 SN492101)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 31, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 70--General-Purpose Information Technology Equipment OFFADD: Dahlgren Division, Naval Surface Warfare Center, 17320 Dahlgren Road, Dahlgren, VA 22448-5100 SUBJECT: 70--RENOIR SOFTWARE (R17040) AND 1 YEAR MAINTENANCE SOL N00178-00-Q-3033 DUE 091100 POC sd13; 540-653-7765 DESC: The Naval Surface Warfare Center, Dahlgren Division intends to award a contract for Renoir software (quantity - 3 each) and the Renoir NL Initial Maintenance (1 year). This software includes the following features: Integrate revision control, Generates block diagrams and flow-charts from HDL descriptions in VHDL and Verilog, Generates HDL descriptions in VHDL or Verilog from user generated block diagrams and flow charts., Generates state diagrams and flow charts, Generates HDL descriptions from user generated state diagrams, Maintains projects in hierarchal fashion in HDL or graphical form, User extendable functionality via perl scripting, and has the ability to analyze dependencies and compile HDL descriptions in proper order. Do not substitute brand names. Delivery is to be made to the Naval Surface Warfare Center, Dahlgren Division, Bldg. 125, Dahlgren, VA by 01 October 2000. Minimum Requirement Methodology - Proposals must meet the minimum requirements stated above. Evaluation will be based on price and required delivery schedule. Award is anticipated 15 September 2000 and will be made using simplified acquisition procedures. The Contractor shall provide a copy of their warranty and any descriptive literature, brochures, etc., with their proposal. The offer must: (1) be for the item described above; (2) be FOB Destination to this Center; (3) include the proposed delivery schedule and the discount/payment terms and warranty duration (4) must be signed by an authorized company representative; (5) include name of authorized negotiator along with telephone number, facsimile number and e-mail address (if available); and (7) include their taxpayer identification number (TIN), Cage Code Number and DUNS number. This procurement is rated DO-A7. Offers are due by 11 Sep 2000, no later than 2:00 PM (local time/EST) to: Code SD132, Room 106, Bldg 183, 17320 Dahlgren Road, Dahlgren, VA 22448-5100 referencing quote number N00178-00-Q-3033 or by express mail or hand carried to the above address. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 70--General-Purpose Information Technology Equipment OFFADD: U.S. Department of Agriculture, National Finance Center (NFC), 13800 Old Gentilly Rd., Bldg 350, MAF, New Orleans, LA 70129 SUBJECT: 70--DB2 BUFFER POOL TOOL/ INTENT TO AWARD SOL N/A DUE 091500 POC Carol Adams, Purchasing Agent,(504)255-5913 DESC: USDA, OCFO, National Finance Center (NFC) located in New Orleans, LA intends to issue an order to Responsive Systems of a DB2 Buffer Pool Tool Software to run on the IBM Sysplex Environment. The DB2 Buffer Pools Tool is tuning device for collecting and analyzing statistical information. The Buffer Pool Tool will predict the effect of recommended changes to the DB2 buffer pools. The Buffer Pools Memory is part of the DB2 Data Base Manager Address Space which contains large amount of data loaded from DASD. Faster access is achieved by loading the data from DASD once into Buffer Pools then subsequent access to the data is achieved much faster from the memory resident data. The Buffer Pool Tool is a productivity aid that automate the gathering of statistics on the use of DB2 Buffer Pools. Based on those statistics, the Buffer pool Tool makes recommendations regarding the allocation of these Pools according to the statistics gathered. The Buffer Pool tool performs the analysis and recommendations to allocate the DB2 Buffer Pools leading the DB2 applications to be turned and preforming at peak levels. Interesting parties which believes itself capable of providing the required software must respond within fifteen (15) calendar days after the appearance of this synopsis submitting technical information and pricing data. No telephone inquiries will be accepted. No solicitation documentation exists and requests for such documents will be considered non-responsive and not valid for further consideration. If no affirmative written responses are received within the time indicated, a contract will be place with the aforementioned contractor without further notice . EMAILADD: Carol.Adams@USDA.Gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-244 SN492244)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 70--General-Purpose Information Technology Equipment OFFADD: USPFO for Utah, P.O. Box 2000, 12953 Minuteman Drive, Draper, UT 84020-2000 SUBJECT: 70--VISUAL AND AUDIO PROJECTION SYSTEM SOL DAHA42-00-T-0006 DUE 092000 POC Diane N. Johnson (801) 523-4094 DESC: The Utah National Guard is issuing a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation and quotes are hereby requested. A witten solicitation will not be issued. This procurement is being conducted under the Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP), as a Request for Quote (RFQ) Number DAHA42-00-T-0006. The incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-17. This solicitation is 100% set-aside for Small Business and is under Standard Industrial Classification Code 3861, with a small business size standard of 500 employees. (A) Scope of Project: Delivery and installation of a visual and audio projection system in the NG EOC at Camp Williams, Utah. System shall be capable of multiple screen projections and sources of input. The proposed system shall be equal to or exceed the following system: two each DA-LITE 83211 High Power Manual Screens; two each EIKI LC-X990 2200 LUM Boardroom Projectors; two each EIKI 0173-4179 Projector Ceiling Mounts; one each Panasonic AG1330 VHS Video Cassette Recorder; two each Panasonic CT2786Y 27" televisions; 2 each Bretford TVCY27TBK Monitor Ceiling Mounts; 1 each TANOY TAN-REVEL (pair) ceiling mount speakers; one each Sony STRDE135 Stereo AV Amplifier/Receiver; two each EXTRON 60-320-02 MVP104GX Multi Video Processor; two each EXTRON 60-312-01 VSC150 Scan Converter; one VTI Cable Bundle to include: two each 25' RGB; two each 25' DUB; four each 3' DUB; two each 3' SVHS; two each surge potected power strips. The contractor shall install and integrate the previous list of components, providing all necessary wiring, conduit, outlet boxes, switches, plugs or jacks, components, etc. The owner will provide a standard size rack cabinet for the installation of the control components. (B) An additional item, one each Proxima DP-9240 Desktop Projector to include hard carrying case and replacement lamp shall be delivered to a different location. Descriptive literature is required particularly if quoting "equal to" products. Descriptive literature shall be of the type and detail to allow for a definitive determination of equality with the specified products. (C) Applicable Provisions and Clauses: (1) FAR 52.212-1, Intructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, Addendum paragraph (d) Product samples - delete in its entirety, paragraph (h) Multiple Awards - delete in its entirety, as the Government plans to award a single contract resulting from this solicitation; (2) FAR 52.212-2, Evaluation Commercial Items (Specifications being met and lowest pricing), (3) FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representation and Certifications Commercial Items, (4) FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions Commercial Items, (5) FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes and Executive Order - Commercial Items. The following clauses are applicable and incorporated by reference: FAR 52.203-6, Restrictions on Subcontractor Sales to the Government, with Alternate I; FAR 52.203-10, Price or Fee Adjustment for Illegal or Improper Activity; FAR 52.219-8 Utilization of Small Business Concerns and Small Disadvantaged Business Concerns; FAR 52.219-14, Limitation on Subcontracting; FAR 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities; FAR 52.222-26 Equal Opportunity; FAR 52.222-35 Affirmative Action for Special Disabled and Vietnam Era Veterans; FAR 52.222-36 Affirmative Action for Handicapped Workers; FAR 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Special Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era; FAR 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer - Central Contractor Registration; (6) FAR 52.274-34 FOB Destination; and (7) DFAR 252.204-7004, CCR Certification. Quoters shall submit a copy of provision 52.212-3 with their quote; it may be obtained at www.arnet.gov/far. All quoters shall price each item separately to include installation and propose a delivery schedule with their quote. (D) Evaluation Factors: The contract type for this procurement will be a firm-fixed price and award will be made on the basis of best value to the Government, including price, delivery and other factors will be considered. Quotations are due in this office on 20 September 2000. Note that registration on the Central Contractor Registration "CCR" database is a requirement for award. The web site for registration is www.ccr2000.com. Oral communications are not acceptable in response to this notice. You may fax your quotation to 801-523-4843, with the quotation number and Contracting Officer's name clearly marked, or email it to the Contracting Officer at johnsond@ut-arng.ngb.army.mil no later than 1600 hours on 20 September 2000. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 70--General-Purpose Information Technology Equipment OFFADD: FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia, 700 Robbins Ave., Bldg. 2B, Philadelphia, PA 19111-5083 SUBJECT: 70--ELECTRONICALLY DISTRIBUTED SOFTWARE LICENSE/MAINTENANCE SOL N00140-00-R-4270 DUE 091000 POC Point of Contact - Guy Goss, Contract Specialist, 215-697-9662, J. J. Swizewski, Contracting Officer DESC: The FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia intends to acquire, on a sole source basis, software licenses and software license maintenance through electronic distribution for the following software products installed or to be installed in the National Imagery and Mapping Agency's network enterprise: 2,000 each Windows Operating System, Office Professional 2000 and BackOffice CAL; 160 each Windows NT/2000 server; 14 each MapInfo Professional; 2,000 each Perform/FormFlow filler; 3,900 each WinZip; 360 each BackUp Exec Server; 29 each BackUp Exec Exchange Agent; 31 BackUp Exec SQL Agent; 360 BackUp Exec Open Files Agent; 100 NetViz and 1 NetViz Web. Software licenses, maintenance and services, are required for the period from 15 September 2000 through 11 September 2002. The required software licenses, upgrades and new versions must be provided via electronic distribution technology (EDT) downloading from the Internet. EDT encrypts the software and creates an electronic container for transmission over the Internet. A password is then Emailed to the customer to unlock the encrypted container. EDT security features must include verification of authorized Internet domain, three levels of encrypted password verification, unlinked secure URL location, previously approved Email address for software unlock key, and self-checking containers to ensure product has not been infected with a virus or otherwise corrupted during shipment. All software updates, upgrades and new versions shall be available via Internet same day received from the publisher; notice of availability shall be sent to the end-user. The Government intends to procure the required electronic software licenses and software maintenance through a modification to contract N00140-98-D-2139 with Beyond.com. The subject contract was awarded to Beyond.com for the provision to NIMA of software maintenance through electronic downloading and distribution. Only Beyond.com can provide the required software licenses and maintenance that will meet NIMA's requirements to ensure consistency in software applications and processing. Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals. However, all information received by the specified response date of September 10, 2000 will be considered by the Government. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed requirement based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. All responses should be directed to the attention of Mr. Guy Goss, FISC Norfolk Detachment Philadelphia, 700 Robbins Avenue, Bldg. 2B, Philadelphia, PA 19111-5082 the standard industrial classification code is 7379. EMAILADD: SYNOPSIS@PHIL.FISC.NAVY.MIL EMAILDESC: CITE: (D-244 SN492372)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 76--Books, Maps and Other Publications OFFADD: National Imagery and Mapping Agency, Contracting Support for Directorate of Operations, Attn: PCM-W/L-13, 3200 South Second Street, St. Louis, MO 63318-3399 SUBJECT: 76--NON-DOD FLIGHT PUBLICATIONS SOL N/A POC Diana Shepard, Contract Specialist, (314)263-4919 x103 DESC: This synopsis is for the procurement of Non-DoD Flight Information Publications for the month of December 2000. The National Imagery and Mapping Agency (NIMA) is responsible for producing all Flight Information Publications (FLIPs) for the Department of Defense (DoD). FLIPs contain graphic and textual descriptions of airspace, air facility data, flight information, airport operating procedures and related data. These publications are printed in the form of books and charts depicting information concerning planning, departure, enroute and terminal phases of flight. Non-DoD FLIPs is defined as any commercially or foreign government produced fligyht information publications or related material not produced by NIMA or listed in the Defense Mapping Agency (DMA) (now known as NIMA) Catalog. Quintessential regions of coverage include but are not limited to: Africa, Atlantic, Alaska, Australasia, Caribbean, China, Canada, Europe, Far East, Middle East, Middle East/South Asia, Mexico, Latin America, South America, North Sea, Pacific, Spain and Scandinavia. This is an ongoing monthly requirement, and NIMA intends to award this requirement for the month of December 2000 to Jeppesen Sanderson. See Note 22. EMAILADD: shepardd@nima.mil EMAILDESC: email. CITE: (W-244 SN492206)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 99--Miscellaneous OFFADD: Southwest Division, NAVFACENGCOM, Environmental Contracts Team/02 SUBJECT: 99--MISCELLANEOUS SOL N68711-00-R-0010 DUE 091400 POC Contract Specialist, Leanora Sili, 619-532-0775 DESC: ENVIRONMENTAL REMEDIATION SERVICES FOR A FIRM FIXED PRICE, ID/IQ CONTRACT INVOLVING REMEDIAL ACTION OPERATIONS (RAO) AND LONG TERM MAINTENANCE (LTM) ON NAVY AND MARINE CORPS INSTALLATIONS AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS PREDOMINANTLY IN CA, AND TO A LESSER EXTENT IN AZ, NV, UT, NM, AK, WA, OR, ID, AND MT Note: One copy of the response to this presolicitation notice is to be delivered no later than 3:00 p.m. Pacific Standard Time, September 14, 2000 to the following address and code: SOUTHWESTNAVFACENGCOM Attn: Rick Lovering, CODE 02R1.RL 1220 Pacific Highway San Diego, CA 92132-5187 ATTENTION SMALL BUSINESSES: PRESOLICITATION NOTICE: Engineering Field Division (EFD) Southwest, Naval Facilities Engineering Command, is planning to issue a small business set-aside solicitation for Environmental Remedial Action Operations (RAO)/Long Term Maintenance (LTM) services and is seeking information from small businesses that will enable the Government to advise potential offerors about their probability of being viable competitors. This presolicitation notice is covered under FAR Part 15.202 Advisory multi-step process. The Government will evaluate all responses to this RFI in accordance with the criteria stated herein, and will advise each respondent in writing (by email, fax, or letter) whether or not the potential offeror is considered to be a viable competitor. The Government will advise respondents considered not to be viable competitors of the general basis for that opinion. Notwithstanding the advice provided by the Government in response to potential offerors' submissions, all respondents may participate in the resultant acquisition. The planned solicitation will be issued under Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code 8744. The small business size standard for SIC Code 8744 is 500 employees. On October 1, 2000, North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) codes will replace SIC codes. The equivalent code to SIC 8744 will be NAICS code 562910, Environmental Remediation Services. Contact your local SBA office for more information. The preponderance of work would be located at Navy and Marine Corps bases located in California, secondarily in Arizona, and to a much lesser extent in Nevada, Utah, New Mexico, Alaska, Washington, Oregon, Idaho, and Montana. EFD Southwest anticipates awarding multiple contracts from the planned solicitation, and competing task orders in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 16.504 (c). Award would be made using FAR Part 15 competitive negotiation procedures to the small business firms offering the Government the best value, price and other factors considered. Fixed price indefinite quantity contracts with terms of a base year and four one-year options would be awarded from the planned solicitation. The estimated EFD Southwest RAO/LTM program value over the next five years is approximately $120M. The total capacity of all contracts awarded from the planned solicitation would be $180M. The number and amount of task orders awarded under each contract would depend upon the results of the task order competition conducted among the firms that would have received contract awards under the planned solicitation. Typical work for this contract would be to operate, maintain, and optimize the performance of ongoing remedial action systems. Types of remedial actions would include, but would not be limited to, capped landfills, pump-and-treat remediation, bioremediation, soil vapor extraction, natural attenuation, bioventing, air sparging, reactive walls, thermal treatment, phytoremediation, soil washing, capped aquatic environments, storm water systems, and free product recovery. This contract would provide the following services: (1) Perform operations, maintenance, and monitoring of remediation systems in compliance with the system's Operations and Maintenance (O&M) Plans, and with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations including, but not limited to: the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA), the Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act (SARA), the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), the Clean Air Act (CAA), the Clean Water Act (CWA), the Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA), the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA), any subsequently promulgated federal, state, and local laws and regulations, and any applicable DoD, Navy and/or Marine Corps policies, procedures, and instructions. (2) Sample and analyze materials and media related to O&M of the remediation systems. (3) Develop technical memoranda and reports including, but not limited to: the findings of inspection, monitoring, testing, and sampling, modeling, five-year reviews and response complete/site closure reports. (4) Evaluate sampling strategy, data collection, QA/QC and field procedures to maximize program efficiency, and support compliance and closure objectives. (5) Optimize system performance by evaluating its design, operation, energy utilization, supplies alternative, equipment reliability, process control, and maintenance program. (6) Identify system upgrades/changes or technology enhancements to improve efficiency and reduce costs. (7) Implement system modifications and revise O&M plans to match the new requirements. (8) Provide technical and administrative support for public involvement activities, as required. (9) Prepare human health and ecological risk assessments, as required. (10) Conduct site verification activities, which may include but are not limited to groundwater sampling, soil gas sampling, and soil sampling and reporting, as required. (11) Evaluate Navy compliance with activity-specific institutional controls, as required. (12) Assist Navy to justify reopening Records of Decision or other Decision Documents and negotiate system shutdown or modification, based on regulatory and technical logic. (13) Develop environmental planning documents required to support any of the activities as stated in individual task orders issued under this contract. (14) Establish, maintain, and perform abandonment of monitoring wells, as required. (15) Manage and dispose of wastes resulting from the work performed under this contract. (16) Provide support with Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Computer-Aided Design (CAD), and electronic data management. Interested small businesses are requested to complete and submit the 2-page "EFD SOUTHWEST/ Presolicitation Notice N68711-00-R-0010/ RAO/LTM Small Business Experience Questionnaire." Included on page 2 of the questionnaire is space to provide an executive summary outlining the potential offeror's qualifications to perform RAO/LTM projects at multiple locations simultaneously in California and Arizona. YOUR COMPLETED RESPONSE INCLUDING THE QUESIONNAIRE AND EXECUTIVE SUMMARY SHOULD NOT EXCEED 2 PAGES (8.5 BY 11). A copy of the required questionnaire may be obtained without cost by accessing the Navy Internet web site at http://esol.navfac.navy.mil/ under presolicitation notice N68711-00-R-0010. Firms do not need to register for the Plan Holders List as this is not a solicitation. Completed questionnaires must be received at SOUTHWESTNAVFACENGCOM, Attn: Rick Lovering, Code 02R1.RL, 1220 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92132-5187 by 3:00 p.m. Pacific Standard Time on September 14, 2000. Responses may be mailed, telefaxed (fax number 619-532-0771), or electronically mailed as an attachment in Microsoft Word to loveringrr@efdsw.navfac.navy.mil, copy to leeak@efdsw.navfac.navy.mil. This Presolicitation Notice is issued for the purpose of allowing the Government to assess potential offerors' ability to be viable competitors in a planned solicitation. It is not a Request for Proposals (RFP). EMAILADD: sililk@efdsw.navfac.navy.mil EMAILDESC: CITE: (D-243 SN492019)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 31, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 99--Miscellaneous OFFADD: Federal Prison Camp, Allenwood, Regional Contracting Office, P.O. Box 1000, Montgomery, PA 17752 SUBJECT: 99--CD ROM LAW LIBRARY MATERIALS SOL RFQ21451-0056 DUE 091500 POC P.A. Donahue-Ormandy, 570-547-1641, extension 543 DESC: The Northeast Regional Contracting Office in Allenwood, PA intends to make a sole source award to West Group for CD-Rom law library materials inclusive of software and license to be utilized at the Federal Detention Center, Philadelphia, PA. West Group will provide mandatory publications on CD-Rom format. The publications to be provided on CD-Rom are the following and will be for five concurrent users: Federal Reporter, Federal Supplement, United States Code Annotated, U.S. Supreme Court Reporter, Atlantic Reporter, American Jurisprudence 2D, Immigration Law and Forms (IRIS), Military Justice Reporter and Code of Federal Regulations. The Contracting Officer anticipates issuing the solicitation on or about September 11, 2000, with a closing date on or about September 15, 2000. Please address all inquiries regarding this acquisition to the named Contracting Officer by September 11, 2000***** cc: OSDBU CITE: (W-244 SN492225)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on August 31, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: September 5, 2000]

THIS IS A REQUEST FOR QUOTATION, INTERESTED BIDDERS MUST HAVE THEIR BIDS IN TO THE CONTRACTING OFFICE WHICH IS LISTED ABOVE ON OR PRIOR TO 14 SEPTEMBER 2000. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 99--Miscellaneous OFFADD: Department of Transportation, United States Coast Guard (USCG), Commanding Officer (vpl), USCG Maintenance and Logistics Command - Atlantic, 300 East Main Street, Suite 600, Norfolk, VA, 23510-9102 SUBJECT: 99--RAYTHEON PARTS SOL DTCG80-00-Q-3DP237 DUE 091500 POC Albie Evans, Contracting Officer, Phone 757-628-4665, Fax 757-628-4679, Email aevans@mlca.uscg.mil - Duncan Whiteside, Purchasing Agent, Phone 757--628-4662, Fax 757-628-4677, Email dwhiteside@mlca.uscg.mil DESC: The requirement is for the following: Contractor to provide all materials and competence to provide the following Raytheon parts: 1. RL70CRC Lcd Color Display(radar/plotter) w/2kw Radome P/N: M92749 Qty (12 ea). 2. ST-60 Depth Display P/N: A22002 Qty (12 ea). 3. Transom Mount Tri Ducer P/N: M78917 Qty (9 EA). 4. Thur Hull Transducer P/N: M78713 Qty (4 ea). 5. Raystar 112LP (Seatalk) Gps Receiver P/N: E32001 Qty (12 ea). Items will be shipped to the following address: Safe Boat International, 8800 Barney White Road, Port Orchard, Wa 98367 . The government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the government, price and other factors considered. The following factors shall be used to evaluate offer: Price, Required Delivery Date. Offers are due on September 15, 2000, 1600 Eastern Standard Time to: Commander (VPL-3) MLCLANT, 300 East Main Street, Suite 600, Norfolk, VA 23510-9102 Attn: Duncan E. Whiteside Purchasing Agent. For additional information on the above requirement phone (757) 628-4662 or fax request for information to (757) 628-4677. _This notice is for informational purposes for Minority, Women-Owned and Disadvantaged business enterprises to acquire short-term working capital assistance for transportation-related contracts. Loans are available under the DOT Short-term Lending Program (STLP) at prime interest rates to provide accounts receivable financing. The maximum line or credit is $500,000. For further information and applicable forms concerning the STLP, call the OSDBU at (800) 532-1169. For information concerning the acquisition, contact the contracting official listed above. PART: SPECIAL NOTICES OFFADD: DOE/National Energy Technology Laboratory, P.O. Box 10940, MS 921-107, Pittsburgh, PA 15236-0940 SUBJECT: ELECTRICTY MARKET INTEGRATION&INTERCONNECTION IN SOUTH AMERICA DESC: SUBJECT: ELECTRICITY MARKET INTEGRATION AND INTERCONNECTION IN SOUTH AMERICA. DESC: The U.S. Department of Energy's National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL), Pittsburgh, PA intends to award a purchase order on a sole-source basis to The Comision de Integracion Electrica Regional (CIER). PROJECT OBJECTIVES/DESCRIPTION: The purpose of this procurement is to support a regional study effort which reviews the opportunities and barriers between the ten (10) major countries in South America to reach regional market integration and interconnection of their electric systems. The study will focus on the technical, operating and commercial standards regulating power transactions, power dispatch, and interconnections and it will incorporate participation and input from the CIER (Comision de Integracion Electrica Regional) members, governments, regulatory authorities, power utilities and private development companies of South America, as well as the World Bank and USDOE. The study is divided into two phases. The first phase will examine the conditions prevailing in the South American electricity sector and the second phase will provide recommendations as to how to promote regional efficiency and increase regional interconnections. SCOPE OF WORK: Phase I will be devoted to the gathering and analysis of basic data related to the technical and operational procedures currently used in the different countries of South America for electricity exchange, as well as to the institutional/regulatory approaches. It will include an analysis of the issues and bottlenecks that may have hampered active development of electricity trading activities within the region. Phase II, in the area of technical and operational procedures, will identify possible harmonization and compatibilities in the various nations' standards and procedures for the operation of electrical systems. It will propose rules related to the operation of international interconnections in normal and emergency conditions. In the area of regulatory aspects it will identify possible options among regulatory or policy issues related to the operation of international interconnections and recommend a minimum common set of rules for ensuring reliability in the functioning of major interconnected systems along with recommendations on rules, procedures and economic transactions methodology to be applied to transmission ancillary services. DELIVERABLES:1 Report Package on current state (as of September 30, 2000) of the Study on Market Integration and Interconnection in South America. This report package is to include the results of the workshop held in Rio de Janeiro on May 24-25, 2000, i.e., all of the presentations made by the speakers (government and private sector representatives) during the workshop (in electronic form); the general report of the results and recommendations for Phase I of the study (in electronic form and hardcopy); and the proposed outline for Phase II of the study. 2.Proceedings of working session to be held in conjunction with CIER's 2000 Congress in Buenos Aires, Argentina (November 26-30, 2000). During this working session CIER's Executive Board and members of the Working Group (of which DOE is a member), will review the draft results of Phase II of the study. There will also be a presentation during the Congress sessions where the results of Phase I as well as the draft results of Phase II will be presented to the congress attendees. The objective of this information dissemination on the study is to obtain feedback and critical support from the South American decision-makers. The feedback will be included in the final analysis of the study. 3. Report Package on final results of the Study on Market Integration and Interconnection in South America. This report package will include the results of the workshop to be held in a place to be determined in April 2001 (i.e., all of the presentations made by government and private sector representatives during the workshop); and the general report of the results and recommendations for Phase II of the study (in electronic form (PowerPoint and/or Word) and hardcopy) including strategy for implementation of the recommendations. This purchase order is being issued to The Comision de Integracion Electrica Regional (CIER) because it is a non-governmental organization which is comprised of the electric utilities and non-profit organizations linked with the national electric sectors of the ten South American countries ( Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay, and Venezuela). CIER was created on July 10, 1964, on the basis of a proposition approved during the First Regional Electrical Integration Congress, then held in Montevideo, as an initiative of the Uruguayan Electric Sector Authorities. The Commission became operational in 1965. Since its beginnings, CIER has gained the support of the South American electric industries, and clearly has reflected the strong need of collaboration among them. CIER is comprised of experienced professionals who have years of demonstrated success in establishing communication at the highest levels of legislative and energy organizations within Latin America. These individuals performance records that are recognized as outstanding and create confidence among the potential customer population. The main objective of this non-profit international organization is to promote and encourage the integration of the regional electric sectors, through greater assistance and technical cooperation of electric power utilities and governmental organizations in the Member Countries; transfer of knowledge, information, experiences and documentation in technical, economic and legal fields; projects development in a regional scope, especially considering the feasibility of electric international interconnections; orientation and coordination of general interest activities for utilities and organizations, including research and development fields; establish general specifications and technical standards which area accepted in all Member Countries; promotion of regional statistic uniformity, strengthened through the operation of an up-to-date Data Bank; and the promotion of electric power regional utilization with special concern about environmental problems. CIER's headquarters in Montevideo, Uruguay holds an important information and documentation center, whose evolution to a computerized Data Bank is being achieved. At the present time, CIER has five areas of the power industry located within this data base (generation, transmission, distribution, commercialization, and corporate) in which the following technical topics are covered: planning and environment, energy movement and transactions, projects and construction works, operation and maintenance, distribution engineering, electric energy commercialization, finance, administrative business and legal and regulatory affairs. In addition, there are specific working groups established within CIER to develop specialized matters, such as the bulk energy markets and interconnections study for South America. The activities which are proposed in this procurement will be used to promote the development of one or several interconnected, cooperative electricity markets, which could translate on business opportunities for U.S. electric private sector companies interested in investing in the region . It will also provide continuity to the DOE effort which was established at the conference, "Integration of Electricity and Natural Gas in the Southern Cone" which was held in Montevideo, Uruguay in 1997. CIER is a organization that is uniquely situated and qualified to undertake this work on behalf of DOE. CIER has a pivotal position in South America as a renowned organization which has the access to power industry data throughout the electricity sector of Latin America and sources of information that is unavailable to the DOE and within the United States. There is no known competing organization that can bring to DOE the same technical and policy level of experience, contacts, and capabilities that are so directly capable of achieving the DOE goals within the South America region. In addition, DOE knows of no other entity which can conduct such an activity and produce a quality study within the time frames prescribed. This request is considered to be sole source to The Comision de Integracion Electrica Regional (CIER). Therefore, no solicitation will result from this announcement. This award shall be made using simplified acquisition procedures. Request for information should be addressed to Mr. Robert L. Mohn, FAX 412-386-4963. PART: SPECIAL NOTICES OFFADD: Department of the Air Force, Air Education and Training Command, Randolph AFB Contracting Office, 395 B Street West Suite 2, Randolph AFB, TX, 78150-4525 SUBJECT: R--WEIGHTED AIRMAN PROMOTION SYSTEM (WAPS) DESC: Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for non-personal services in accordance with the format in Subparts 12.6 and 13.5, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The Air Force has a requirement to implement the Weighted Airman Promotion System (WAPS) Test Compromise Program at Randolph AFB TX. Period of performance will be 01 Oct 2000 through 30 Sep 2001, with an additional four (4) option years. No telephone request for solicitations will be accepted. Interested eligible contractors are encouraged to submit written request for solicitation. Facsimile request will be accepted at (210) 652-5171, ext 3050. This acquisition has been set-aside for 100% small business. The Standard Industrial Code is 8742 with a size standard of 5 M. All responsible business sources may submit a proposal, which will be considered. Offerors must provide a cage code and ensure that they are registered in Central Contractor Registration (CCR). Award will be made using Simplified Acquisition Procedures, The following FAR clauses and provisions apply to this requirement which can be viewed throught Internet access at the AF FAR Site, http://farsite.hill.af.mil.: 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items (Aug 98); 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items, (May 99), 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items (Apr 98); FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders _ Commercial Items (Jan 99); 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity (Feb 99); 52.222-35, 52.222-36, Era (Apr 98); Affirmative Action for Disabled Veterans of the Vietnam Affirmative Actions for Workers with Disabilities (Jun 98); 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era (Jan 99); 52.232-33 (Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer-Central Contract Registration), 52.233-3 (Protest After Award) and 52.252-2 (Clauses Incorporated by Reference). Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders Applicable to Defense Acquisitions of Commercial Items (Jan 99); DFARS 252.225-7001; Buy American Act and Balance Payment Program (Mar 98);252.204-7004, Required Central Contractor Registration (Mar 98); 252-204-7004, Required Central Contractor Registration (Mar 98). OFFERS MUST PROVIDE INFORMATION ON THEIR PAST PERFORMANCE TO INCLUDE CONTRACT OR ORDER NUMBERS, REFERENCES (NAMES) AND PHONE NUMBERS. OFFERORS MUST ALSO SUBMIT A TECHNICAL PROPOSAL DESCRIBING PROCEDURES FOR CONDUCTION THE WEIGHTED AIRMAN PROMOTION SYSTEM (WAPS) TEST COMPROMISE PROGRAM. THE GOVERNMENT WILL MAKE AN AWARD TO THE RESPONSIBLE OFFEROR WHOSE OFFER CONFORMS TO THIS REQUIREMENT AND IS CONSIDERED TEHCNICALLY ACCEPTABLE CONSIDERING PRICE AND PAST PERFORMANCE, AS FOLLOWS: (1) PRICE (2) ABILITY TO PERFORM AND (3) PAST PERFORMANCE. THE GOVERNMENT RESERVES THE RIGHT TO AWARD A PURCHASE ORDER TO OTHER THAN THE TECHNICALLY ACCEPTABLE LOWEST EVALUATED PRICE OFFEROR IF THAT OFFEROR IS JUDGED TO HAVE A MODERATE OR HIGH PERFORMANCE RISK RATING. Offer must be sent to the Contract Specialist above not later than 08 Sep 00 and should reference the Solicitation listed above. OFFERORS MUST INCLUDE WITH THEIR PROPOSAL A COMPLETED COPY OF THE PROVISION 52.212-3, OFFERORS REPRESENTATIONS AND CERTIFICATION-COMMERCIAL ITEMS. Awards will be made effective 01 Oct 00. Contractors must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) prior to receiving any contract award. You can register in the CCR by calling 1-888-227-2423, or via the Internet at http://ccr.edi.disa.mil. All responsible sources may submit an offer, which, if timely received, will be considered by this office. For more information contact Ms Jerri L.Ryan at (210) 652-5171, ext 3050 or email jerri.ryan@randolph.af.mil. See information for SStatement of Work (SOW)below. On-site support for individuals shall be required to have and maintain a Secret Clearance. Offerors must submit their proposal by email, jerri.ryan@randolph.af.mil, phone (210) 652-5171, ext 3050. Offerors must submit evaluation criteria on Price, Ability to Perform and Past Performance, all responsible business sources may submit a proposal, please contact Ms Jerri Ryan for a copy of the Statement of Work (SOW)and Individual Technical Evaluation Rating Record Criteria for Award. Copies will either be faxed or emailed to potential offerors, contact Ms Jerri Ryan at (210)652-5171, Ext 3050 or email jerri.ryan@randolph.af.mil for a copy of required documents.
